ResponsesInList.Title: Temporarily register an existing student in an alternative attendance register
ResponsesInList.Text: Currently we have two groups attend on a Monday for five sessions. And a different two groups attend on a Wednesday for five sessions. I have set up five attendance registers for each group for the relevant days and it has been repeated weekly until July 2026. My manager has asked, if a student cannot attend on a Wednesday then can they be added to an existing Monday attendance register for just that single week. The registers are manually marked by the tutor in class. Can you advise me if this is possible? Thanks Pat

ResponsesInList.Title: Temporarily register an existing student in an alternative attendance register
ResponsesInList.Text: Is this a single class? I think what you would probably need to do is set up another group with just that student in it and create a separate session for them. If you set it as multiple sessions initially, I do not believe that you add a person to just a single session.

ResponsesInList.Title: Temporarily register an existing student in an alternative attendance register
ResponsesInList.Text: I thought that was probably the case. Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance grade of 100% after only attending one session
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello all, Am I correct in my understanding that if an Attendance module has 6 sessions (with a goal of giving folks a passing grade in the course if 5 out of 6 sessions are attended) a student's grade will show as 100% after attending the first session (i.e. attendance for upcoming sessions not having been taken yet)? I also see a grade of 100% being given if attendance is not recorded at all for the first 2 sessions for a given student, but they are marked as Present for the last 4 sessions. If the above is correct, does anyone know of a straightforward workaround to achieve a passing grade when 5 or more workshops out of 6 are attended (short of creating 6 separate Attendance activities , putting them in a Gradebook category, etc.), and having the grade appear correctly throughout the course (i.e. before attendance for all sessions has been taken)? As always, thanks in advance for your time! Steve

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance grade of 100% after only attending one session
ResponsesInList.Text: I love the Attendance activity for the recording of attendance, but I don't use any of the reporting methods included in the plugin. Instead, I use the Configurable Reports plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/block_configurable_reports ) to create custom reports. I have reports in the courses, so that teaching staff for the courses can keep an eye on their students, I also have global reports so that tutors can monitor their students across all of their courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance - Automatic marking setting is missing from V4.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All We have just updated to 4.5 from 4.0, and in Moodle Version 4.5. I don't see the 'Automatic marking' setting on the Attendance activity when creating sessions. Is there an administration setting that needs to be switched on to make this available? Thanks in advance Conor

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance - Automatic marking setting is missing from V4.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorted - the "Auto-mark status availability handling" setting in the Administration - Plugins - Activity modules - Attendance has to be turned on (attendance | automark_useempty) Then you can decide on Automatic marking (attendance | automark_default) This fixed the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Limited time for the attendance self-mark
ResponsesInList.Text: in the status set configuration you can set how long a status is available for - for example the status Present can be available for 5min after session start, Late can be available for 20Min and then Absent could be the only status available after that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Error: Self-marking has been disabled.
ResponsesInList.Text: Complete error message is: Self-marking has been disabled for a session because this device appears to have been used to record attendance for another student. It can't be truth as I'm trying it from a testing iPad where we didn't even had the login done. Attached are attendance's settings and the error the students get. At the moment with iOS 18.2.1 and 18.3.1 Do you have any hints from where this error might be coming? Thank you very much, Javi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error: Self-marking has been disabled.
ResponsesInList.Text: it's the setting down the bottom "Prevent students sharing IP address" that is triggering this. If you are getting this error when you know the users are using different devices it likely means that Moodle is not recognising unique IP addresses for each user connecting to your site. This might be due to your Web server configuration or a shared network using something like a proxy which makes all users look like they are using the same IP address. In that case you will not be able to use this setting within the attendance plugin - set "prevent students sharing IP address" to "No". Moodle does have some admin-level settings that allow it to control where to look for the users IP Address - ask your Moodle admin to take a look at the "getremoteaddrconf" setting under admin > server > HTTP - they may need to add a list of your organisations web proxys to the ignore list and may also need to adjust which HTTP header contains the users physical IP address.

ResponsesInList.Title: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: We have students that have managed to self record their attendance for sessions in the future. Looking at the settings for the attendance session, all seems to be okay. The session is only open for 5 minutes before hand. I am assuming that the session was originally incorrectly set to be open for some longer time in advance. Does anyone know of any other way that the students could have recorded attendance for a session in advance? Secondly, the lecturer is now asking if we can delete the students' Present record for the future attendance session. I can only see a way to change the marker from Present to Absent, not to delete the record entirely. Is the only option to delete the session and recreate? Attendance version: 2024072400 Moodle 4.4.2 (Build: 20240812) Any input welcome, thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: I can report the same problem. We do self-registration via QR code. The students scan the QR code with their smartphone and are then marked as present. However, a few students have managed to circumvent this daily attendance check by registering directly as present for future appointments. After the problem arose, I was able to find out through a conversation with the students that the problem was with the smartphone registration. Once the QR code has been successfully scanned, the students are taken to an overview where they can also see all future dates and register for them directly. However, this only works via the smartphone directly after attendance has been determined. A direct click on the attendance module in a desktop browser for example shows them the overview of their own registration but does not allow them to register early.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the report - can you please report this to the github issues tracker - along with a screenshot of your status set settings - in particular the "Self-marking availability" and "Available before session start" settings. and also a screenshot of the "student recording" settings in the session and I'll take a look! thanks,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for reviewing my problem. I openend the github issue here: https://github.com/danmarsden/moodle-mod_attendance/issues/807

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for sending that through - I couldn't spot anything obvious in your list - I don't get a lot of time for to work on things as a volunteer but I'll try to find time to look further into this one sometime. If you have internal development capabilities, pull requests are always welcome!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: I've just had a look and I can't seem to reproduce this unless you've disabled the "studentscanmarksessiontime" setting at the site level - (which is ticked/enabled by default) Can you please check that setting and see if is unticked? That setting is quite old and was used as a blunt way to allow students to record attendance at any time rather than using the open/close date restrictions - in most cases you should leave that setting alone but it's possible that people are using the attendance plugin in a way that doesn't rely on open/closing dates/times and need a way to disable that handling.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Dan, thanks for staying on the case. We are currently on school vacation and I can't access the server , but after the vacations I will check the field directly and get back to you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am Christine's colleague. Investigating the logs and the settings, it turned out that some of the course admin's misused the 'Available before session start' checkbox on the Status set settings page. They ticked the box for the (P)resent status. They were not aware of the side effects, and deliberately let the students choose (P)resent in advance. So as far as I am aware, we didn't have a glitch or bug in the plugin. That is the only way I was able to reproduce the 'issue'. We have contacted them all and advised them to change that setting. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student self recorded for future sessions

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I have another question. Is it possible to include custom user fields, such as hobbies or professions, in the attendance list? We provide language courses and work with a co-teaching system, meaning 2 to 3 teachers give a course on different days. We want to make it easier for the teachers to bring more empathy into the courses. For example, if vocabulary needs to be explained, a teacher could say, "This is Maria's profession or hobby." It would make things clearer for the teachers. Thanks in advance, Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Daniel! 😊 First, we need to define where these fields should appear. Would you like them to be displayed directly on the attendance list that teachers use when marking attendance, and which plugin are you using for attendance tracking? Or would it be more interesting for teachers to access this information in a separate report linked to the attendance list? Eduardo Kraus Teacher and Developer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Eduardo Thank you, obrigado, for your answer. We are using mod_attendance version 2024042203, and it would be great if the items could be displayed directly on the list, like this: I tried to modify the code in the renderer.php file, but without success. Unfortunately, I am not a developer or coder and cannot make these changes myself. Perhaps there is an easier solution that I’m not aware of right now. Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel! 😊 The path you've started is absolutely correct! On GitHub, you can take a look at the code mentioned in your post, specifically at this link . Now, the first part of the solution is simple. Go to Administration in your Moodle, then click on Users , and within that section, select Permissions . Then, go to User Policies and look for the field called " showuseridentity ". This is where you can configure which user fields you want to display. For extra fields, I added one at line 755: Next, you need to add the `$row->cells[]` for the specific data you want to display. So, after line 834, I added: Eduardo Kraus Teacher and programmer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: or alternatively - that page uses the moodle core "show user identity" settings. If your custom field is a short text field and has a maximum length of 255 chars or less, then you can select it in the admin level setting "show user identity" and then it will show on this page (as well as various other Moodle reports where user data is displayed.) If you only want it showing on the attendance plugin reports - then you will need to modify the code like Eduardo mentions above.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Custom user fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you so much! You’ve been incredibly helpful, and I decided to go with Dan’s no-coding approach. It worked perfectly, and I guess I should probably take a Moodle user course to explore all the features thoroughly. I should have read the information on user fields—or as we say in German: Wer lesen kann, ist klar im Vorteil (Those who can read have the advantage). So, thank you again! Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Back button on Mobile after submitting attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am new to Moodle, and thank you very much for the Attendance module! I have a question regarding the functionality on Mobile. After submitting the teacher attendance form, the app takes the teacher to the activity page with the stats. Then, if the teacher presses the back button in the header, they are taken back to the attendance form which they have just submitted. That is somewhat counterintuitive, because they have just submitted the form and they probably want to go back to the course page (if they want to resubmit the attendance they can click the update attendance button again). My question: after submitting attendance, is it possible to make the back button in the header take the teacher back to the course page and not the form page? Another option: in the form submit action, instead of "method="mobile_view_activity"" what would be the right thing to write to take the teacher straight to the course page? Thank you very much!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Back button on Mobile after submitting attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: I wanted to follow up on this, and share what seems to have solved the problem. In "mobile_view_page_latest.mustache" and in "mobile_teacher_form_latest.mustache" I have added to  the "ion-button" element these attributes at the end: [preSets]="{getFromCache: 0, saveToCache: 0}" refreshOnSuccess="true" samePage="true" Now after submitting the attendance form the back button takes back to the course page. Best regards!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Back button on Mobile after submitting attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the update! - if you get a chance it would be great if you could open an issue in the github issues tracker for this along with your possible fix - and even better if you are able to submit a pull request with the patch it would be great!

ResponsesInList.Title: Late student arrival with self-recorded student attendance with a rotating QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Apologies if someone provided the answer to my question earlier and I couldn't find it. Is the following possible? I would like to let students record their own attendance by scanning the QR code with the QR code changing every 15 seconds and that Moodle record automatically if students scanned the QR code before the beginning of class (e.g., 10h30) so that the students are marked present but that if the student scans the code after a certain time (e.g., 10h32), Moodle automatically records the student as late. What times would I need to include in the session field here: to make that happen (if it's possible)?  Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Late student arrival with self-recorded student attendance with a rotating QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: yes - it's possible - you need to set up you status set so that the "Self-marking availability" is set to "Limited time" and the "Present" status is only available for 2 mintues (or more) and then the subsequent "Late" status should be available 60minutes (or less) from the session start.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Late student arrival with self-recorded student attendance with a rotating QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Late student arrival with self-recorded student attendance with a rotating QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: A follow-up question: does the Moodle output for attendance record the precise time that a student would scan the QR code to indicate that she or he were present and, if so, can that be exported with other information?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Late student arrival with self-recorded student attendance with a rotating QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: the time the user submitted their attendance status is recorded - which isn't quite the same time that the QR code was scanned, but should be pretty close - attendance plugin also has a custom report source which includes the timemodified fields so you might be able to create a custom report (under admin > reports > custom reports) that includes the information you're after.

ResponsesInList.Title: Rotate QR code / password
ResponsesInList.Text: What is the difference between Rotate QR code/password interval (seconds) and Rotate QR code/password expiry margin (seconds)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Rotate QR code / password
ResponsesInList.Text: rotate qr code interval (when the code changes on screen) rotate expiry margin (when the password embedded in the QR code expires.) The expiry margin needs to be long enough to deal with the fact that a phone will take a few moments to scan the code, load a page - at least a couple of seconds - but ideally not long enough for someone to take a photo of the qr code and send it to their friend working from home... hopefully that's clear?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Rotate QR code / password
ResponsesInList.Text: where do you set the expiry margin? Do you need to have site admin credentials or a standard  person with Teacher roles can modify the expiry margin for the session? Right now it is set to 15 secs on my University Moodle but it is too short for all the procedure to be completed. Thx!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow students to record own attendance using QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, You can register the attendance automatically if you setup the plugin from the plugin options within the course in the session section. I guess that if the teacher is able to see the QR is because you already did it, but there are many options you need to take into considerations to make it work propperly. On the other hand, all attendances already registered can be modified from: course->attendance->session->edit. Hope this information helps you. Kind regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow students to record own attendance using QR code
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, To automatically register attendance, you can configure the plugin settings within the course's session section. Ensure that you've set up the plugin properly, including specifying which attendance statuses should be recorded automatically. If the teacher can view the QR code, it suggests that you've already completed this setup. However, it's important to review all relevant options to ensure smooth functionality. Remember, you can also modify attendance records for sessions that have already taken place. Simply navigate to: course -> attendance -> session -> edit. I hope this information proves helpful. If you have any further questions, feel free to ask. Best regards, Kevin

ResponsesInList.Title: Can you change grading?
ResponsesInList.Text: I noticed today that for students with "Excused" absences, they are getting only half-credit automatically. Grading is set to "Point" and cannot be changed at this point because grades are already entered. Is is possible to set it somehow so that Excused gets full credit, or do I just need to correct it manually at the end of the semester? We are already 4 weeks in and I've logged excuses for the entire semester already (sports etc.) so I don't want to start from scratch.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can you change grading?
ResponsesInList.Text:
I do not think you can make these kinds of changes after any attendance sessions have been recorded. To change it so that Excused gets the same credit as Present, it can be changed in the Site Attendance settings. Under the tab 'Default status set' you can customise the value of each status. When you create a new attendance activity, it will use these values. I understand that you are already 4 weeks in but you could do the following: 1) Export all attendance data for the course so you don't lose who attended when 2) Create a replacement attendance activity (name it something slightly different to the old one so you don't muddle them up). 3) Create all replacement sessions for your course 4) For each session you have already recorded, you can upload a CSV file to repopulate the entries: a) Click the button to start the register b) Click 'Upload attendance by CSV' c) Drag and drop a csv file with just two fields. I did email and status e.g. 
```text
    email,status


    examplestudent1@thisplace.com,P


    examplestudent2@thisplace.com,P


    examplestudent3@thisplace.com,A


    examplestudent4@thisplace.com,E
```
 Apparently it will except username as an alternative to email but I didn't try that. 5) Delete the old attendance activity

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance Security and QR Codes
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We have several of our training programmes using the attendance plugin for their training days. One of the biggest selling points for attendance was the QR code option that becomes available on sessions once 'student self-record' has been enabled. However, one of our administrators noticed that some trainees who weren't in attendance had somehow marked themselves present even though they weren't there to scan the QR code. I realised that the QR code wasn't a key as such (which is what I had assumed), but rather just a hyper link to the self-record page, and any trainee was able to login and self-record during the hours of the session, even if they haven't scanned the QR code. I thought I'd fixed this by setting the attendance activity settings to "Available but not shown on course page", but some clever trainees had still found their way to self-record their session, likely through the gradebook or from attendance notifications. Is there a way we can keep using QR codes, which our training schemes absolutely love, but have these QR codes be the only way for trainees to self-record attendance? We really don't want there to be any way for absent trainees to mark themselves present. Is the only way to do it to also use the passcode along with the QR code? Please let me know if you can advise.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Security and QR Codes
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ben - when creating the session you need to do one of the following: Set a student password value Tick the Random Password box Tick the Rotate QR Code box. Obviously point 3 will force the QR code to rotate, making it harder for users to take a photo of the QR (or just grabbing the url from the QR code) and sending it to their friends but you need to make sure your webserver and the machine using to show the QR code have their time synced correctly otherwise errors may occur. hope that helps!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The number of absences or the sum of presences and absences exceeds the total number of sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: That does look strange! -There has been a few different reporting bugs fixed over the years, so make sure you're using an updated version of the plugin, and a recent supported version of Moodle. There was also a few bugs related to duplicate attendance states being stored - so there's an upgrade script that will clean that up too. If you are already using the latest version of the attendance plugin, and a recent supported version of Moodle, I think you'd need to do some further investigation yourself to work out why those reports are not generating the right data and then see if you can find a way to reproduce it and add that to the github issues tracker (If you can't provide me with a way to reproduce it, I'm unlikely to be able to spend any time investigating a fix.) thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance with Natural Grading
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We are having an issue with grading for the Attendance module. It works great for taking attendance. However, it calculates a student's grade oddly if you are using natural grading for the course. Specifically, it scales the grade up percentage and point wise based on the student's attendance to date. The logic is so that the student is not penalized for classes that have not yet occurred. However, the grade is inflated to the max points for attendance for the entire course. For example, if the total attendance grade for the course is100 points for 10 classes - the student will see they have 100 points in the gradebook after the first class attended rather than the 10 points they have actually earned. The problem resolves itself at the end of the course when all sessions have been completed. However, it skews the grade while the class is still in progress. Has anyone else encountered this and do you have any recommendations? Thanks! Eric Evans Union College

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance with Natural Grading

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance with reverse proxy
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
Is it possible to use Attendance restriction by IP address when the 
server
 is behind a reverse proxy?
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  Attendance with reverse proxy
ResponsesInList.Text: The Attendance plugin uses the Moodle core API "Getremoteaddr" to obtain the users IP address - which uses the site level setting getremoteaddrconf to control how it obtains the users ip address - you can find this under Administration > Server > HTTP Basically if you check your standard Moodle logs reports - if you see everyone with the same ip adress (your reverse proxy IP) then it won't work - if you can see different IP addresses listed, then Attendance should work fine.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  Attendance with reverse proxy
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much it helped me a lot

ResponsesInList.Title: Student recording QR issue
ResponsesInList.Text: QR code will redirect students to their unit homepage instead of taking attendance. Any advice?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student recording QR issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Please make sure you have the latest version of attendance installed for the version of Moodle you are using - keep in mind that I do not support Moodle versions that are no longer supported by Moodle. - what version of Moodle are you using and what version of the attendance plugin do you have installed? If you are using the QR rotation feature, make sure the time of the machine displaying the QR code is correct and synced and your Moodle server also has the correct time - if it is more than a couple of seconds out, it may be displaying the wrong QR code to users or the server may not be able to validate that the qr code is still valid.

ResponsesInList.Title: Auto based on Activity Complete has error message
ResponsesInList.Text: When I set my attendance in Student Recording to Automatic Marking, then Select one instance of Activity Completion, then finally trigger it using the "Manually Trigger Automated Marking" I get an error message: No unmarked status is configured for this session (id:272), to fix this update the Status set I've searched the documentation, but there is very little on using Activity Completion in the Attendance Plugin. I'm guessing I have to make a new Status Set but am not sure how to indicate "Unmarked". I'm also unsure if I need to set a "Marked" or "complete" option in the status set for the students who have finished the Activity Completion. Please advise, or point to a relevant manual page? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto based on Activity Complete has error message
ResponsesInList.Text: You shouldn't need to create a new status set, just edit the settings of the status set in use, and in the column for "Automatically set when not marked" - select one of the status values to be used when the unmarked process is triggered.

ResponsesInList.Title: New functionalities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We have developed some new functionalities based on this plugin. The main objective was to create a report in order to give tutors access to a simple yet effective way of seeing their students' attendance on each course We have developed two plugins, the report mentioned above and a block that can show tutors their students with lowest attendance. A detailed explanation of their functionality can be read hereunder. Report Attendancetable This plugin adds a report to show the attendance percentage of all students enrolled on a course. It generates a table counting all of their attendances on each course (present, absent, late and excused) and calculates the attendance percentage on each attendance activity and the average percentage across all courses. Students can also view said information about themselves. Block Attendancetable This plugin adds a block that shows tutors their students with the lowest attendance percentage an easier to access view for their own attendance. The student block shows each attendance activies' attendance percentage, the course's percentage, the average percentage across all courses they're enrolled on and a bar (which can be toggled off by the tutor) with each session's attendance info, which includes: the date and time, the status and the attendance activity name. Additionally, students can add this block on their dashboard , which is similar to the course block but has a bar for each course instead. All views have a link to the report mentioned above. Don't hesitate to let us know if you have any suggestion.
role: Picture of Alexis A22 FCT Navas Esteban

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New functionalities
ResponsesInList.Text: awesome! - thanks for sharing them with the community!!! I've had a very quick look at the code and reported a couple of things to your github tracker for you to consider but it would also be great to see these submitted to the moodle.org plugins db so that they get more exposure and other people can find them! The other thing I'd recommend you take a look at sometime is the custom report source available for attendance in Moodle 4's report builder tool and the ability to develop/code system level reports using that api ( I've been trying to build out reports in our other plugins using reportbuilder's api rather than the older tablelib/renderer outputs myself, and my longer term plan is to try and replace some more of the core Attendance reporting functions using reportbuilder based reports too.

We will work on the changes you mentioned in the following days and once done, we will notify you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggestion - how to prevent students of taking attendance for their groupmates during the offline sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: There are a number of commercial tools that provide this sort of attendance tracking. Some provide an export function that would allow you to import the results into Moodle, but it's not currently something supported by the attendance plugin. I have though about building this into the Moodle app but there's a lot of development work involved there and it would really need someone to fund the development.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggestion - how to prevent students of taking attendance for their groupmates during the offline sessions

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggestion - how to prevent students of taking attendance for their groupmates during the offline sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately "votes" don't really drive development or features like this one - I wish I had a pot of $$ that paid for my time to develop features for attendance based on votes!!! Typically feature development on the attendance plugin is completed by in-house developers working for an organisation that needs the feature - eg an in-house developer at a university who then submits a Pull request with the feature to the upstream version for review - or sometimes an organisation will fund a Moodle Partner to develop the feature who will push that feature in. Moodle "core" development is funded in a few other ways - do a search for Moodle users association, "how is moodle funded" to find a few relevant posts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem Automatically set when not marked
ResponsesInList.Text: Great to hear it's working for you. Yes the scheduled task "Check for attendance sessions that require auto marking" is responsible for making that change and by default it runs once an hour - you can change that if you need to but it's usually more efficient to run it less frequently if possible. Yes - auto-marking must be enabled for it to mark students as absent - here's what the help string for that setting states: If "Yes" students will be automatically marked depending on their first access to the course. If "Set unmarked at end of session" any students who have not marked their attendance will be set to the unmarked status selected. thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem Automatically set when not marked

We'd be happy to share the plugin if someone has the need for the same functionality. Here is the query: SELECT DISTINCT c.id, SessionData.userid, SessionData.firstname, SessionData.lastname, c.fullname AS name, c.startdate, c.enddate, SessionData.completedtime, SessionData.totaltime, SessionData.wage FROM    course    c JOIN    attendance    att ON att.course = c.id JOIN (SELECT sct.userid, sct.firstname, sct.lastname, sct.attendanceid, sct.completedtime, sct.totaltime, sct.wage FROM (SELECT users.id AS 'userid', users.firstname, users.lastname, ats.attendanceid, SUM(IF((acronym = 'P' AND atl.id > 0), duration, 0)) AS completedtime, SUM(ats.duration) AS totaltime, atw.wage FROM    attendance_sessions    ats JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT usr.id, usr.firstname, usr.lastname FROM    user    usr JOIN    role_assignments    ra ON ra.userid = usr.id JOIN    role    role ON role.id = ra.roleid WHERE role.shortname IN ('teacher', 'editingteacher')) AS users LEFT JOIN    attendance_log    atl ON atl.sessionid = ats.id AND atl.studentid = users.id JOIN    attendance_wages    atw ON atw.attendanceid = ats.attendanceid AND atw.tutor_userid = users.id JOIN    attendance_statuses    sts ON (sts.attendanceid = ats.attendanceid AND sts.id = atl.statusid AND sts.deleted = 0 AND sts.visible = 1) GROUP BY atl.id) AS sct) AS SessionData ON 1 = 1 JOIN    user_enrolments    ue ON ue.userid = SessionData.userid JOIN    enrol    enr ON enr.id = ue.enrolid WHERE enr.courseid = c.id And the output, where you can see that the competed time equals total time whoch should not be the case. id userid firstname lastname name startdate enddate completedtime totaltime wage 1126 9 Špela Test TEST Špela - ResponsesInList.Title: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear developers of the Attendance-Plugin, I am very
interested in using your module to track attendance of students within
Moodle. However, in my university the option of restricting the
IP-addresses to avoid external registrations is not useful, because
the IPs of the student's mobile devices can not be fixed or assigned to specific
locations. Another possibility is to extract the BSSID of the WiFi access points of the student's phone/PC when connected to the
universities WiFi. I would like to be able to give a list of admissible
BSSID (MAC-adresses) of APs in the vicinity of the class room (instead
of IPs) which are cross-checked by moodle on the student's devices when
they register their attendance. Is it possible that you extend the implementation of you module?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text: As mentioned in your github issue (but here is a better place for this so I've closed it there...) I can't see how this would work - the users SSID is not passed in the request headers from their browser to the web server - so "Moodle" can't find this information out. Usually in this sort of scenario I've seen organisations add the full IP range of known addresses, and then use the QR Code rotation process for marking sessions - that way it forces both the use of the university network, and access to the current QR code... of course that doesn't stop people bringing in multiple devices and taking attendance for their friends. We only get the users originating IP address - The only way I can think this would be possible is to have some form of API that allows Moodle to ask your network infrastructure "what access point does this IP address use" - but that would be heavily dependent on your network infrastructure and heavily custom to your specific environment (and hard to make it generic/useful for other organisations not using the same infrastructure.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your quick reply. For various reasons in our seminar we try to come close to that physical process of "stamping with a time clock". The WiFi access point takes the role of a piece of physical hardware the students have to shake hands with. In our case, opening the entire IP space is really not optimal, because we also must rely only on a single QR-code displayed to all the students, which would be quickly shared to anybody at home... BSSIDs can be detected by eg Android apps, but it seems not really possible in a browser with php/ javascript , which is probably what you refer to. The API should use things like this: Java Examples & Tutorials of WifiInfo.getBSSID (android.net.wifi) | Tabnine , I guess, but no idea how to realize this. Maybe this would work inside a Moodle android app? Quite a bit of an effort, though... Money is not the problem, but rather to go through the administrative offices of our university to be allowed to use the money to fund you. Depending on your experience with such interactions we can surely talk about a project.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text: haha "Money isn't the problem"? - not often I hear that (I work for the Moodle Partner Catalyst IT, so yes we have a lot of experience working for universities) Keep in mind - that the QR code sign-in process has a QR rotation feature, allowing you to have a WR code that expires within 5 seconds or less - which does make it harder, but of course a student could pull up a video call with their friends and allow them to see the qr code on a device and scan it remotely..... Yes - we can get at the SSID from a Mobile app, however in your initial post you stated that you wanted to allow it from the "student's phone/PC" - (not just phones) - If you could force all your users to use an android or iOS device and install a custom mobile app so they could track their attendance, then yes, it might be possible. There are probably 2 ways to do this - we could build you a custom app just for attendance tracking, but it would probably be better to build you a branded Moodle Mobile app and bake the attendance improvements into the custom build for you. It's possible we could push some of the improvements into the open-source mobile app build, but we'd probably need to discuss the details and you'd likely need a good sized budget to support it., But... here's the big thing - you need to work out, how important is attendance tracking - and how much will the feature actually decrease the ability of learners to game the system - the answer is - probably not by much.... devices are extremely cheap, it's relatively easy to bring in multiple devices into a large room and they can just scan themselves and their friends in using different devices... Could that expense be better spent on other methods of attendance tracking that would be more accurate and better prevent "cheating the system" - possibly? - but feel free to reach out privately if you'd like to fund some development on this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I start to see the dimensions of that. Thanks much. I might get back to you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BSSID(MAC address) instead of IP address
ResponsesInList.Text: cool - I saw your message - will reply shortly... but one thing I realised last night while thinking on this further that might make also this a bad investment of funds. Student 1 - connects in class - finds the access point BSSID (pretty easy with a range of different tools/apps.) - sends the BSSID to their friend... or just takes a record of the BSSID, wanders around the site and generates a full list of BSSID values on site and shares it with all their friends. Student at home modifies the mac address (BSSID) on their cell-phone(easy with a number of different free apps) turns mobile hot-spot on, connects their laptop or other mobile device to that hotspot with the modified address and bingo - it lets them record attendance without being on site. lets take a stab in the dark at the cost of developing a custom mobile app with these features and include time spent by university staff/meetings to discuss/lawyers to sign contracts etc.. - lets say USD $60,000 (probably more) worth of effort between all parties, thwarted by a student with an hour of free time then a simple method of reproducing a way to get around it for all your students on site.

ResponsesInList.Title: integration
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
Can attendance 
activities
 be integrated with other activities? so what I mean is I want to make the user required to fill in attendance before being able to access or continue to other activities.
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: integration
ResponsesInList.Text: If you have a single attendance activity with a single session contained within the activity you could probably do it that way - unfortunately you can't control activity restriction by pointing at a specific session. you can set up the attendance activity to be flagged as complete when the students get a passing grade, then set up a single session in the activity to give them a passing grade when they have attended the session, then you can set up the other activities to be avaialble when the attendance activity is flagged as complete. There's probably a good use case for someone creating an activity restriction plugin that allowed the teacher to point at a specific session within the attendance activity to give more flexibility.

ResponsesInList.Title: All past attendance records for users whose enrollment end
ResponsesInList.Text:
Just realized when a user's enrollment ends, the user's record in the attendance report disappears. Why is that?
How can the records of all past sessions for students whose enrollment ended be kept in the report as well?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: All past attendance records for users whose enrollment end
ResponsesInList.Text: this is typically how Moodle activities work - when a user is un-enrolled from the course, the information associated with their grade/assignment submissions (and attendance) are removed from view in the reports - If you would like to retain this information in the course reports you can "suspend" a users enrolment rather than remove it, which prevents them from accessing the course, but keeps the data in the reports visible to teachers. The data for un-enrolled users is still retained within the attendance tables, so it's possible we could improve the attendance reporting to include un-enrolled users, but that would likely require funding for my time to improve the reporting. The longer term aim is to replace some of the reports within attendance with the new Reportbuilder API that is available in moodle 4.0 and higher though - so I'd prefer to see that work completed first before we added further functions to the reports.

ResponsesInList.Title: Fichier CSV - Format des données
ResponsesInList.Text:
Bonjour, Quelqu'un aurait-il un fichier à importer, avec des exemple de données, dans le plugin Attendance. Après plusieurs essais, mon fichier est toujours rejeté. Merci pour votre aide. Bénédicte 
```text
Hello,

Does anyone have a file to import, with sample data, into the Attendance plugin. After several tries, my file is still rejected.

Thanks for your help.

Benedicte
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fichier CSV - Format des données
ResponsesInList.Text:
The format isn't documented well, but the following three formats worked for me. You can use the users username, idnumber or email address fields to identify the student. Note that the column label must match the fieldname you are using. (The Moodle Upload users documentation defines the field/column names). Set the status column according to the letter defined in the "Acronym" column in the "Status set" page of the Attendance activity. The scantime column can be in any valid date/time format supported by the PHP strtotime() function, and you can also leave it out of the CSV file if you prefer. 1. User ID Number ('idnumber') field as identifier 
```text
idnumber
,status,scantime
Z9990101,P,2022.06.29 10:00
Z9990102,L,2022.06.29 10:20
Z9990103,E,
```
 2. User email address ('email') field as identifier 
```text
email
,status,scantime
alice@gmail.com,P,2022.06.29 10:00
bob@gmail.com,L,2022.06.29 10:20
charlie@gmail.com,A,
```
 3. User ID ('username') field as identifier 
```text
username
,status,scantime
alice.student,P,2022.06.29 10:05
fred.student,L,2022.06.29 10:25
harry.student,E,
```

ResponsesInList.Title: 3 lates = 1 absence options?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am relatively new to the Attendance activity. Thanks for what seems to be a very useful plugin. I was recently asked by a client about a novel situation. Apparently, their school has a policy that 3 lates equals 1 absence and a student can not receive credit for the course after a certain percentage of absences. He asked for help with a solution. I came up with the following status set that seems to work by using zero for present and negative values for lates and absences. The report converts the lates to absences in the points. It's not very elegant, but it seems to work. Does anyone have a better solution?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 3 lates = 1 absence options?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have the same requirements and the solution that works well here is to make one "presence" or "excused" worth three points, one "late" worth two points and an "absent" worth zero points. This calculation method simply reduces the value of each absence by one while keeping the numbers other than "absent" positive integers, allowing the percentage column to be non-zero and therefore remain accurate as an overall metric for total attendances. There doesn't seem to be an elegant solution. I hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 3 lates = 1 absence options?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your suggestion, Wes. I like using the positive numbers better, but I found that using decimals produces a result closer to what I was looking for. Presence / Excused = 1, Late = 0.67, Absent = 0.

(it may just be I'm using the wrong wording) I need to be able to check that the attendance is being completed by the teachers after each session, as they tend to leave it to the end of the month and then make mistakes. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly/Monthly attendance report - all courses
ResponsesInList.Text: That's not something currently supported out of the box. If you have someone that is able to write SQL -based reports for you, it is probably possible using the custom report or ad-hoc report plugins - but this is the sort of thing I'd like to see possible via some custom reports using the new Moodle 4.0 reportbuilder feature (we'll need to write a custom report source for attendance to support it but hopefully I'll find time to do that after 4.0 release.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Self-reporting Attendance Configuration
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle version 3.11.5 with the latest version of the Attendance plugin installed. I have been trying to get this to work for our use case and I have hit a dead end. Perhaps someone here can offer a hint. Our intended usage: We have a blended class where we deliver lectures to students via Zoom (without the Moodle plugin) and we provide all the other learning resources in a Moodle course. We would like to use the Attendance plugin to track that they went to the Zoom lecture. We would like to use the "self-reporting" feature with a different codeword for each session, that will be presented during the Zoom. We would like to allow them to self-report their attendance in Moodle any time after they get the codeword, for a fixed period of time after the Zoom is finished. Let's call it two days. I set up each session with the date and time of the Zoom, and I create a codeword. I went into the "Status Sets" and put a value of 2880 (2 days in minutes) under "Available for Students" ... and save it. During that date and time window, Submit attendance is available for my students to click on, key in the codeword, and they can self-report. However, after the end of the specified time window, Submit attendance disappears ... it does not seem like my 2880 minutes from the time the session begins is valid. I was then thinking that it is possible that the Attendance date and time was intended only for the session time in which they may mark themselves present (i.e., they must be in Moodle during that windows). My workaround would be to make the "Session" last two days ... but a session can only take place in one date with a start and end time. So ... any suggestions? What am I doing wrong?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Self-reporting Attendance Configuration
ResponsesInList.Text: We use this almost exactly the same way, except I make them log in during the Zoom session so that they don't get to go and give the code out to their buddies that missed the training for whatever reason!  I am pretty sure that the plugin is tied to the course length because I actually had to hack the code to allow our attendees to log in a little before the start of the training.  Without the hack (which was a very clumsy adding of -7200 to wherever I found the coursestartdate in a couple of the files!!), the session would be hidden because it was starting prior to the start of the class.  I would think you could actually do the same hack to add time to the courseenddate or time or whatever it is called.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto Attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: We've been working on a patch for the attendance plugin this week that allows you to add an attendance session, but link it to the completion of another activity which might help? - basically you add the session in attendance eg Monday 1-2pm and then link it to the completion state of the BBB activity, and cron runs and will flag the session attendance based on the status settings - eg if the "Passed" status is available for 10min, then anyone entering before 1pm until 1:10pm will be flagged as "passed", if the Late is available for 30min then anyone that arrives between 1:10pm and 1:30pm will be flagged as Late etc. That should be ready in the latest version of the plugin next week.

ResponsesInList.Title: Students take attendance for thier colleagues
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I have Moodle server hosted in the cloud and we are accessing it from the university using one IP address which is the firewall IP address. accordingly I can't enable the attendance plugin feature of preventing students from not sharing the IP address. the students scan the QR code, attend themselves and attend thier colleagues. can can we prevent this? please help Thank You

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students take attendance for thier colleagues
ResponsesInList.Text: 1. A student can record only the attendance of himself/herself, so if they are doing it for other students, that means they are sharing usernames and password. No? If that's the case, this a more serious problem than just recording attendance for other students. 2. You can set the QR code to rotate, and rotate fast enough so hopefully students won't be fast enough to share it effectively. See the following settings in the Site Administration -> Plugins -> Activity modules -> Attendance area: Rotate QR code/password interval (seconds) [attendance | rotateqrcodeinterval] Rotate QR code/password expiry margin (seconds) [attendance | rotateqrcodeexpirymargin] Of course you have to set the QR to rotate in the activity itself. If you don't have this option and settings, maybe you are using an old version of the "Attendance" plugin. 3. If your students attend the campus physically, and you're not already using this option, check the  " Require network address" [ attendance | subnet] option and related settings. This way you can limit student to record attendance only while being connected to the campus Wi-Fi, for example.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students take attendance for thier colleagues
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yes the students are sharing thier user name and password we already implemented the QR code rotation every two minutes and the margin 1 minutes we already implemeted " require network address" and they can sign from the campus only still have the problem that they sign for each other as they are sharing thier user names and passwords together. how this can be fixed ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students take attendance for thier colleagues
ResponsesInList.Text: you should be able to modify your firewall to pass through unique IP addresses to the server via extra headers - take a look at the discussion here for some tips on it and how to configure Moodle to find the correct unique address: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=385061 But... that doesn't stop students bringing multiple devices and recording attendance for themselves on one phone... and attendance for their mate on another phone... Phones are pretty cheap, I have a drawer full of old devices here myself... The other thing you can consider to make it harder would be to implement 2FA for your students - requiring them to login with a second factor - not just a password - your existing identity provider might already have this functionality, otherwise you could use our MFA plugin: https://moodle.org/plugins/tool_mfa One of the things I've thought about in the past is to somehow re-trigger the MFA token request on the take attendance page but that would require some development. but.. to be honest - the students will probably find a way around it - all you can do is make it harder.

ResponsesInList.Title: Change Calendar Event Title
ResponsesInList.Text: When adding an attendance session and creating a calendar event with it, the title of the event that shows up is simply "Attendance." This transfers to Google calendar export as well. Can this event title be changed? It becomes difficult and confusing when you are enrolled in multiple courses and calendar only shows "Attendance." Yes, when you click the event, all information shows. I've tried changing the Name of the attendance in setting, but still it only shows 'Attendance.'

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change Calendar Event Title
ResponsesInList.Text: You might find it is a language setting, in which case you could change it that way...maybe do a search in the language strings and see if one references the event title.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change Calendar Event Title
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe the event is given the name of the activity itself, and by default, the name "Attendance" is filled in automatically when you create a new Attendance activity. If you change it to e.g. "Company Law", then when sessions are created, they will use that name instead. Unfortunately, calling the attendance activity by the course name is not very useful. You could consider giving the new activity the course name first, then creating all the sessions so that the events have a sensible name, and then renaming the activity to "Attendance".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance API
ResponsesInList.Text: You could query the database with either ad-hoc queries https://moodle.org/plugins/report_customsql (or search for adminer.....)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance API
ResponsesInList.Text: make sure they are using a supported version of Moodle, and have the latest version of the attendance plugin for that version - then the built-in webservices documentation should show all the webservices specific to attendance that are available. you can also see a partial (less easy to read) list of these in this file: https://github.com/danmarsden/moodle-mod_attendance/blob/MOODLE_311_STABLE/db/services.php Note that these expect you will use other core webservices for getting information about the course, users etc.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance API
ResponsesInList.Text: Web Services you've mentioned are already available for us. However, these services do not provide data we are trying to obtain. None of those will return attendance data for, lets say a course, or a an enrollment, or a user, or a category. None of them describes that it returns any attendance data for that matter. So, I am a bit confused how attendance data is supposed to be accessed in the first place. If we can not find relevant "stock" Web Service, can this be resolved by adding some sort of a plugin or a report that would be designed for our needs either by our client's Moodle host or by us? Also, the thing that Marcus mentioned above , "ad-hoc" queries, could we use them, and if yes, what is the way for us to get to that functionality? Are there any documentation files regarding?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance API
ResponsesInList.Text: yeah - you'll need to call multiple web services. first you need to know "which" attendance you want information about first so you'd use something like the core get_course_contents webservice to get information about the attendance instances inside that course, then once you have that information you can call the attendance get_sessions() web service to get information about all the sessions within that course/attendance. then once you have the sessions you can use that information to call update_user_status directly or get_session to get more information about a specific attendance including who has attended that session. Good luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance API
ResponsesInList.Text: " we are aiming to offer an easier initial experience by turning a number of advanced features off by default" I suggested that just so you can see what is in the datatable in order to write code to access that data. As Dan says you would need to make multiple calls for your specific requirements. Although you could write your own custom services Ito do multiple things I suggest using what exists as it has already been written, tested and debugged. I do almost nothing but moodle dev and find the best documentation to be reading code, its fairly guaranteed to be up to date.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Emma, When a student is enrolled in a class later than others, her name is listed in attendance list in earlier days than her enrollment. There is no way to deselect her attendance once an option is selected. If there is an exempt status added, it is the same as choosing other options. ResponsesInList.Title: Suggested enhancements to the Attendance plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, We're heavily dependent on the Attendance plugin. We have courses that run for the whole of the semester containing hundreds of users. We use the attendance plugin to define "Lessons", or "Lectures" within the course. The courses consist of a face-to-face lecture and a subsequent Quiz. The activity setup is like this: One Attendance activity One Quiz activity To prevent the users from seeing the Quiz before-hand we have added an access condition for the Quiz (i.e. users need to get a pass grade in the Attendance activity to be able to see the Quiz activity) The current design of the Attendance activity doesn't seem to implement the concept of "adding users on a per-session-basis before-hand and then allowing the teacher to mark the users as present when they show up for the lecture (whose duration corresponds w/ the session duration)". What I would have liked to see is a feature were we would be able to add a set of users before-hand to a specific Attendance session but not setting their attendance status at this time. Then, during class, the teacher could just tick them of as present/absent, preferably using a block showing the users for the current session and check box next to them. Are there any other methods to achieve this, maybe? Kind regards, Peter Rundqvist

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggested enhancements to the Attendance plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: The current design of the Attendance activity doesn't seem to implement the concept of "adding users on a per-session-basis before-hand and then allowing the teacher to mark the users as present when they show up for the lecture (whose duration corresponds w/ the session duration)". What do you mean? This is exactly what happens when you add a session...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggested enhancements to the Attendance plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Emma, I’m not sure I understand exactly what you mean; adding a session and then clicking ”take attendance” only present me w/ a list containing *all* participants. I then need to browse through the list and mark the attendance for the user. The problem is, given that we have hundreds of participants and the lack of a search box (only being able to use the first/last name filter isn’t an effective way of finding the desired participants), that this is a very time consuming activity during a live class situation. If it would have been possible to put a subset of participants into the particular session beforehand, it would have simplified the process a lot. Do you mean that you are able to do that? In our setup, this possibility doesn’t exist. Kind regards, Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggested enhancements to the Attendance plugin

ResponsesInList.Title: Duplicate Attendance activities in 3.10
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, we just upgraded a testing server to Moodle version 3.10.4 and started testing. We have both the Attendance activity mod_attendance and the block block_attendance installed. I've noticed that there are duplicate instances of Attendance listed wherever all activities are shown e.g. under Site administration / Plugins / Activity modules / Manage activities and also under Site administration / Courses / Activity chooser / Recommended activities. The activity chooser will also show our instructors the duplicates, it's not just on the admin side. Here's an example screenshot: We only have one instance of the mod_attendance plugin installed (I assume Moodle makes it impossible to install multiple of the same plugin anyway), so this is very mysterious to me. Is this a bug with Moodle 3.10 or with the plugin? Has anyone else witnessed this behavior? You can see our workaround—we simply hid one of the activity instances—but it's still strange.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duplicate Attendance activities in 3.10
ResponsesInList.Text: someone must have copied the "attendance" plugin and renamed it to something like "attendance2" but not adjusted the lang string pluginname which is set to "attendance" - it will probaly appear in the mod folder on your server too. If you hover over the "uninstall" link of both plugins you'll probably find the correct one has uninstall=mod_attendance in the url, but the other has a slightly different name like mod_attendance2 or mod_someotherpluginname .. theoretically on some file systems "attendance" is different from "Attendance" - I wonder if somehow you've also got it installed twice with different case use in the directory name.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duplicate Attendance activities in 3.10
ResponsesInList.Text: There wasn't another Attendance plugin on disk anywhere and the settings/uninstall links both pointed to the exact same URL . Interestingly, if I try to show or hide the second Attendance plugin, only the first one is affected. Must be somehow related to how the /admin/modules.php page is coded (looks for the first plugin with a matching name and changes its visibility). I looked at the "modules" database table and found the duplicate there: we had two modules with `name = 'attendance'` . One of them (the second, the one with higher `id` number) had no associated instances in the "course_modules" table. Given that this is our test server , I went ahead and deleted the second row out of the database . Everything seems normal now, no adverse effects yet. My guess is the attendance plugin installation must have somehow been interrupted in the past and the database step was duplicated. It's strange it was only noticeable on 3.10.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duplicate Attendance activities in 3.10
ResponsesInList.Text: weird - I haven't seen this before - not sure how it could have occurred.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Import sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello friend, I've played around with the plug in quite extensively, and to my knowledge there isn't a way to upload sessions, that being said, creating mass reocurring sessions for an entire class takes about 30 seconds to a minute (unless you're adding extra information, like session information for each class, etc.) Even if there was a way to upload sessions, the attendance activity is created IN a class, so you would still have to upload it by each individual class, and likely formatting all that would be a bigger headache than simply doing it manually. Best of luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Import sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: session creation is possible using the csv import tool available in the admin level setttings page for the attendance, however this is an admin-level setting and cannot be peformed by a normal teacher. Teachers can also mark sessions using csv import process - go to mark an existing sessoin and you should see the ability to upload a csv to the page. The Attendance plugin also includes a number of webservices which can be used for session creation and marking by external systems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance sql query

I found following sql query SELECT DISTINCT att.course AS courseid,c.shortname AS Nomducours,att.name AS Module,attsess.id AS sessionid, attlog.studentid AS studentid,u.firstname AS Prenom,u.lastname AS Nom,attlog.id AS logid,attlog.statusid AS statusid,attsta.description AS description FROM mdl_attendance AS att JOIN mdl_attendance_sessions AS attsess ON attsess.attendanceid = att.id JOIN mdl_attendance_log AS attlog ON attlog.sessionid = attsess.id JOIN mdl_attendance_statuses AS attsta ON attsta.id = attlog.statusid JOIN mdl_user AS u ON u.id = attlog.studentid JOIN mdl_course AS c ON c.id = att.course ORDER BY att.course,attsess.id,attlog.statusid; Can somebody help me to modify that so it will be show the date, similar to the way it shows in the regular attendance export file? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance sql query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello friend, I changed the code so that it will present the dates properly, I've also added a few things like the instructors email, etc. Hope this helps! SELECT DISTINCT u.firstname, u.lastname, c.shortname AS 'class', attsess.sessdate as 'class date', attsta.description, attsess.lasttakenby as 'instructor', attlog.remarks, attsta.grade, attsta.deleted, FROM_UNIXTIME (attsess.sessdate, '%D %M %Y') AS 'Class Date', (SELECT u.username FROM mdl_user as u WHERE exists ( SELECT attsess.id from mdl_attendance_sessions WHERE u.id=attsess.lasttakenby )) as 'instructor' FROM mdl_attendance AS att JOIN mdl_attendance_sessions AS attsess ON attsess.attendanceid = att.id JOIN mdl_attendance_log AS attlog ON attlog.sessionid = attsess.id JOIN mdl_attendance_statuses AS attsta ON attsta.id = attlog.statusid JOIN mdl_user AS u ON u.id = attlog.studentid JOIN mdl_course AS c ON c.id = att.course ORDER BY att.course, attsess.id, attlog.statusid

ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Dan! Now is there a way for Moodle to take attendance automatically based on the day the student did an activity?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Attendance in 3.5 version
ResponsesInList.Text: There is an automatic marking process but it looks at course access (not at a specific activity)- eg if they accessed the course at any time during the session they will get marked. You need to have a status set that has matching status values available during the session - in a typical 1 hr session you might have Present - available for first 5 minutes Late - available for first 30 minutes Really Late - available for 60min Absent If the session is a "full day" you'd need those available optoins set much larger. If you manage to get this working - would be very nice if you could improve our docs for the next person trying to do it:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Attendance in 3.5 version
ResponsesInList.Text: Dan, For compliance reasons, they would have to submit an activity such as a discussion post, an assignment, or a quiz. Just entering and roaming around would not meet our accreditation or the DOE's guidelines.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Attendance in 3.5 version
ResponsesInList.Text: right - that's not something that the attendance currently supports. Feel free to get in touch privately if you would like to fund any improvements to the plugin to meet your needs. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Parent Report

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "Actions"
ResponsesInList.Text: So I found what the problem is, but where to edit it is what is beating me now. There is a class called "action-icon". When I do an inspect on the location that the icon is supposed to be " a.action-icon{visibility:hidden;}" appears. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "Actions"
ResponsesInList.Text: There are a few different places this could come from. * if you're using a custom theme, try switching to Boost to see if that fixes it. If that fixes it, the css will be contained within your custom theme somewhere. * check the customcss in your theme - most themes have a "customcss" field in the moodle settings that allows for extra css to be added. * check to see if you have installed any 3rd party themes that have a styles.css file that contains this change. Moodle bundles the css from all plugins into a single css file. good luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "Actions"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance events in Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: doesn't sound familiar sorry. Calendar events are optional in attendance - you can disable them completely at the site level under admin > activities > attendance And then when creating the session itself, you can decide if this specific session should have a calendar event as well. There is also a "fixcalendar" script that can be used to check that all sessions that have calendar "enabled" have a corresponding event in the course calendar. hope that helps!

ResponsesInList.Title: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, Is  there any way to mark attendance of students while offline  (similar to offline quiz)  on moodle mobile app? (The requirement is teacher should be able to mark attendance of students while offline from moodle mobile app. When internet is available attendance get updated with moodle website.) If yes, then please guide me to achieve this. If no, then I would be happy to contribute in this community to implement this. Any pointer in right direction will be highly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Offline support for attendance within the Mobile app is not currently supported. The attendance plugin uses the newer (and simpler) method of using PHP code, templates and Ionic markup within the attendance code to allow support within the mobile app - unforuntately this method does not currently provide support for offline access. It might be possilbe to develop a remote add on (see https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_2_(Ionic_1)_Remote_add-ons ) but I'm not sure if I'd be all that keen including that in the core Attendance codebase. You could look into adding support to the Moodle mobile app code so that the newer method supports offline access, but there is probably quite a bit of work involved there - and you'd need to get it accepted in the moodle mobile core code before adding support to the attendance plugin. thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks @Dan Marsden for your reply and guidance. I will first read provided link and work on yours suggestion and reply soon. Thanks and regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan Marsden , I have a query:- Why this newer method does not provide support for offline access ? Is there any technical constraints or it is purposefully left out ? As Attendance plugin use CoreCourseModuleDelegate in newer method to add support in moodle mobile app.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I would like to do this project under GSOC 2020. I have discussed some queries and an approach to implement this project in my previous message. Please review it Please provide your valuable feedback/suggestions with respect to it? I have also discussed about this project on Moodle mobile forum, here is link of my discussion: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=395116#p1592971 Thanks and regards -- Shiv Charan https://github.com/ShivCharanSharma https://codebuddy.code.blog/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: 'Why this newer method does not provide support for offline access ? Is there any technical constraints or it is purposefully left out ?' It's mainly PHP based and the mobile app does not have an internal system for processing PHP. You would probably need to write a solution in ES6 (the latest version of Javascript ). Your proposal looks reasonable , though there are people far more expert than me who can give an opinion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shiv, I haven't looked into the way the app currently deals with the "offline views" but I assumed they were just read only / cached pages with no ability to make them dynamic or write to the internal Sql Lite db. My assumption would be that to facilitate offline access with the ability to store data into the sqllite db we would need to either develop a remote add on like I mentioned above, or develop this functionality within the Moodle app codebase, however I'm willing to see my assumptions proved wrong! If you'd like to improve the ability for offline pre-fetched pages in the app to be dynamic or store information within the sql lite db, I'd suspect you would need to dig into that process a bit more than I have to find out how much work might be involved in adapting the app to support this. As mentioned earlier - I'm not convinced that I would want to maintain a remote add on within the Attendance plugin db - anything that lands in the plugin becomes my problem to maintain in future, so if you decided to go this route you would need to work extremely hard to convince me of the benefits and of your ability to knock this out as part of GSOC. thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan and Marcus, Thanks for your reply, As the general structure of implementation of offline feature will be almost same for offline attendance as in offline quiz. So, I have read the implementation of offline feature of quiz in moodle mobile app. For offline feature, quiz module use TypeScript code written in "moodleapp/src/addon/mod/quiz/providers/" folder. Here TypeScript code handle all function such as prefetch, quiz,saving of response, synchronisation etc. We can also use similar approach. In order to add offline functionality for attendance in moodle mobile codebase moodle mobile app community's opinion is very crucial. But unfortunately I did not get any response from 29 December to till now Now I am working on more details of working of offline quiz and offlinefunctions option of moodle mobile app. And also waiting for moodle mobile app community's response Thanks and Regards, -- Shiv Charan https://github.com/ShivCharanSharma https://codebuddy.code.blog/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance with Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shiv, Sounds like you have made some good progress investigating this - great!! FYI I am a volunteer GSOC mentor, and I volunteer time working on a number of plugins (like Attendance) so I won't always have time to respond quickly. The Quiz activity is built into Moodle core, where-as the Attendance plugin is a 3rd party plugin - typically only "core" plugins are supported directly within the app, so there might be a barrier getting attendance specific code built-into the core Moodle app. Typically the remote add on option is used for this - and I don't really want to maintain a remote-add within the Moodle code-base unless a client funded my time to do this with the intention of helping with the maintenance costs. If you could improve the existing app in a generic way that allows for plugins to make better use of offline capabilities without having to build specific plugin code within the app that might be more acceptable to the mobile app team.
