'' : '').fullname($student).((!$att && $update) ? '' : '').''; Add this line below it: $table->data[$student->id][] = profile_display_fields($student->id); Drop the attached profilelib.php file into your mod/attforblock folder.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add a "profile_field_Class" in the list of students
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot Mr. Barry ... your instructions helped me a lot, but I think there is something wrong because the code shows automatically the first custom profile field only, so how can i specify which custom field I want to display?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add a "profile_field_Class" in the list of students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi F S, Try doing this in the attendances.php file: Add another header the same way you added one for 'Class'. Then find this code in the attendances.php file: $table->data[$student->id][] = profile_display_fields($student->id); And change it to: $profilefields = get_records_select('user_info_data', 'userid='.$student->id, '', 'data'); foreach($profilefields as $field) { $table->data[$student->id][] = $field->data;} This solution will add a data in a column for each custom profile field you have. If you have more than the 2 custom fields and you only want to use two specific ones you'll need to go about it a bit differently: Something like: // this is for the first profile field. Change '1' to whatever datafield id corresponds to the field you want to use $profilefield1 = get_records_select('user_info_data', 'userid='.$student->id." AND fieldid='1'", '', 'data'); foreach($profilefield1 as $field) { $table->data[$student->id][] = $field->data;} // this is for the first profile field. Change '2' to whatever fieldid corresponds to the field you want to use $profilefield2 = get_records_select('user_info_data', 'userid='.$student->id." AND fieldid='2'", '', 'data'); foreach($profilefield2 as $field) { $table->data[$student->id][] = $field->data;} I haven't tested the second solution so if you need to use it just let me know if it gives you any problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Latest up to date version of Attendance
ResponsesInList.Text:
There are two versions of attendance out there. One you can download from the Modules and Plugins page ( here ) and the other is in CVS contrib (contrib/plugins/mod/attforblock and contrib/plugins/blocks/attendance). Foolishly I assumed that the CVS version would be the most up to date and found that there are SQL errors produced when the initial install updates the database . In fact it seems that the version on the modules and plugins page is the newest and most reliable. With downloaded version in moo-plugins/attendance and CVS version in moo-plugins/contrib here's a diff on the mod/attforblock/RELEASES.txt file: 
```text
/moo-plugins/attendance]$ diff -iwBu mod/attforblock/RELEASES.txt ../contrib/plugins/mod/attforblock/RELEASES.txt
--- mod/attforblock/RELEASES.txt 2009-02-28 23:11:13.000000000 +0000
+++ ../contrib/plugins/mod/attforblock/RELEASES.txt 2009-02-23 20:16:23.000000000 +0000
@@ -42,8 +42,3 @@
 * permissions improved
 * backup/restore improved
 * export improved
-
-2.1.0 - 28 feb 2009 - Dmitry Pupinin [moodle.org member]
-+ hidden sessions displayed
-* format of backup changed
-* bug fixes
\ No newline at end of file
```
 What this shows is that the downloaded version has changes made 2.1.0 - 28 feb 2009 Hope this helps others avoid the faffing about that I did Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Latest up to date version of Attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Mark - Sorry to hear about the confusion you had with CVS and thank you sharing your experience. I think for most folks, the Modules and Plugins database provides the easiest way to get the latest version of CONTRIB code. For those experienced with CVS, you have to keep in mind which version you are getting as we have multiple branches. For that matter, even within the Modules and Plugins page you need to keep in mind which version you are getting. Moodle uses CVS branches for each major version of Moodle (1.8, 1.9, etc.). In theory, the code for the 1.9 version of the attendance package found in Modules and Plugins should be the same as the code found in the MOODLE_19_STABLE branch block and modules you mentioned in CVS. The link in Modules and Plugins points to the Moodle download server which should keep an up-to-date copy of whatever is in CVS. What may have happened in this case is that the maintainer applied a change to 1.9 version or the HEAD version and not back to the other. So at least in theory the code from M&P and CVS should be the same. It would be good if we could track down what happened here to understand what might cause others confusion and elliminate it. Thanks for your attentiveness to this. Do not hesitate to let me know if you have any questions or need anything. Peace - Anthony p.s. - A package is nothing more than a combination of various plugins (blocks and/or modules) and makes a convenient download of a single zip file possible. It just combines the code from CVS.

I developed it myself using modules and modifying them, but minor things I mentioned remains. a) students select a group to attend (the group automatically has the session details, so we dont need to create individual session, but 12-14sessions as we have that many weeks. To update student grades for attendance we just toggle between different groups. b) we have labs/classes where there raw mark for attendance can be a decimal based on our criteria. its not exactly an integer. we have max scores eg 5 and least 0.And we can range the scores 3.5, 4, etc as our attendance criteria is based also on student response in labs to questions Finally, even with radios the tool is useful, so long as we have decimals to grade. The acronym field size should be more than just 2, maybe about 4-5. If you are able to give me ideas on how to do the decimal bit, because I need to change the xml file, it would be great. I can work with PHPMYAdmin, but it defeats the purpose of standardizing the module. As for the future, this tool is our future. I only need this minor change of adding username and decimal place grading. That's it. I have already been able to change the field size in the database , and also change the field size in php code, but you seem to have some rule that prevents adding the variables to the database. It really is a small request if you have time. It only makes your tool better and more credibility to your work, which does still have many limitations. There is no purpose of having many days of the week to grade, when the groups exist to represent them, and student sign up for those days. Having text box is the same functionality as using range of values in radios. That is why, when creating variable, its better for the user to choose whether check box or radio or text, and leave the values in the value as the max value to be obeyed. But that is just my opinion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Specific Modification to Attendance Module
ResponsesInList.Text: The 'Session Days' are the days of the week in which the sessions occur. They are not the starting days. The 'Session Date' is the Starting date. To get rid of the start time (why would you want to do this...?), you'd need to edit the add_form.php file. On line 18, change $mform->addElement('date_time_selector', 'sessiondate', get_string('sessiondate','attforblock')); to $mform->addElement('date_selector', 'sessiondate', get_string('sessiondate','attforblock')); I wouldn't recommend doing it though. To change the labels on any of the screens:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Specific Modification to Attendance Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Find this code in the manage.php file: $table->head = array('#', get_string('date'), get_string('time'), get_string('duration', 'attforblock'), get_string('sessiontitle','attforblock'), get_string('subject','attforblock'), get_string('teacher','attforblock'), get_string('description','attforblock'), get_string('actions'), get_string('select')); $table->align = array('', '', '', 'right', 'left', 'left', 'left', 'left','center', 'center'); $table->size = array('1px', '1px', '1px', '1px', '*', '*', '*', '*', '1px', '1px'); Change it to $table->head = array(get_string('week'), get_string('startingdate', 'attforblock'), get_string('time'), get_string('duration', 'attforblock'), get_string('sessiontitle','attforblock'), get_string('subject','attforblock'), get_string('teacher','attforblock'), get_string('description','attforblock'), get_string('actions'), get_string('select')); $table->align = array('', '', 'right', 'left', 'left', 'left', 'left','center', 'center'); $table->size = array('1px', '1px', '1px', '*', '*', '*', '*', '1px', '1px'); Now find this line: $table->data[$sessdata->id][] = userdate($sessdata->sessdate, get_string('strftimehm', 'attforblock')); Change it to: //$table->data[$sessdata->id][] = userdate($sessdata->sessdate, get_string('strftimehm', 'attforblock')); Find the file mod/attforblock/lang/en_utf8/attforblock.php add this line: $string['startingdate'] = 'Starting Date';

ResponsesInList.Title: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'd like to use the Attendance module to keep track of attendance, but don't want it to appear in the gradebook (students are not graded based on attendance).  I can't find any way to turn off the link to the gradebook; it looks like the students have grades of 0s for perfect attendance. Is there anything I can do to use the Attendance module without grading?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook?
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe I was successful doing this when I made a hidden category of "uncategorized" in the gradebook and moved attendance there. But it might depend on which version of attendance you have, 2.0.3 or 2.0.4. Also, in the grade calculations, I left out the "uncategorized" category (I was doing sum of points). I tell you this only to give you a place to start--I might not know exactly what I did! atw

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook?
ResponsesInList.Text: When Attendance is set to Hidden in the Gradebook students do not see it. Depending on how your grades are calculated, changing the Attendance to "0" will mean that it does not get included in the overall course grade. Neither of these unlink Attendance from the Gradebook, but the result is similar from the student's perspective.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook?
ResponsesInList.Text: I had the same issue. As I spend all day playing with code anyway and am sure that we will never want attendance in the gradebook I went for the approach of removing the links in the code. See here for instructions Mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook? Workaround
ResponsesInList.Text: We adopted the workaround of creating a separate Category altogether, called "Attendance" and set its Item Weight to zero. Then put the Attendance activity as the only item in that category. That way Attendance works as usual but the category will not be calculated in the final grade.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the module be used without linking to gradebook? Workaround
ResponsesInList.Text: In last version of module you can just set "Grade" option to "No grade" in preferences page of Attendance module.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: No MySQL tables being created
ResponsesInList.Text: According to the manual ( http://au.php.net/manual/en/function.array-intersect-key.php ) array_intersect_key is only in PHP 5, and so should not be used at all in standard Moodle 1.9.4. I have just checked, and it is not being used anywhere, so I guess this only affects a 3rd party module, presumably attendance. And while Moodle 1.9.x will work on PHP >= 4.3.0, upgrading would be a really good idea. 4.3.1 must be ancient, and therefore will have a lot of known security holes.

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Moodle quizzes for attendance monitoring
ResponsesInList.Text: Note: This message may appear in multiple forum threads, as I hope it will be of interest to many. Fellow community members, I understand that a Moodle module for attendance is now in late stages of development / testing phases. I would like to take this opportunity to discuss a Moodle solution that Manchester Metropolitan University (MMU) has developed. For the past 2 academic years MMU Department of Computing and Mathematics (DoCM) has been utilising the Moodle quiz module to monitor the attendance of students known as the Student Monitoring System (SMS). MMU staff understand the need for an attendance monitoring system in order to protect the best interests of the student; not only to ensure the best academic performance possible, but also the pastoral care of students who have for instance, recently moved away from the parental home for the first time. Attempts at MMU for paper registration systems and in-house developed electronic solutions have failed to engage staff due to the commitment required to enter data manually from the capture sheet, nor the student body as it does not offer them any added value. The quiz module has been used in DoCM by setting 2 Moodle quizzes for each day of the academic calendar; AM and PM. The quizzes are Subnet IP restricted, so students must be within the department network range to be able to respond to a quiz. As teaching from within the department is mostly “hands-on” there is no issue of time required for a student to log onto Moodle to respond to the sessions quiz. Students are only expected to respond to 7 quizzes per week, of the possible 10 (Monday - Friday, AM/PM) to show their commitment to the course. In exchange for students engaging in the quizzes, within the feedback of the Moodle quiz a link to the forums is shown. Though like virtually all university courses a forum has been available for many years, since the beginning of this experiment there has been an increase in forum posts of 50 fold, creating a community spirit within each year group. Further to this, students understand the requirement for the University to monitor their attendance and when asked, most students will report that the system shows that the University care about their well being as well as their education.

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance v1.2.0 improved
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Dmitry for your module. I have used it in a course without problems for two weeks. The course has 157 students and 3 teachers. We take attendance in classrooms where students access the course information during the session period. I have made an improvement on your module to take a semi-automatic attendance. I have added a “filter students by session access” button (it is really a link) that removes students that don´t have made any click at the course during the session period. If the filter is active, then a new column shows information about student´s accesses during session period. The information that this new column shows is: 1. The IP from where the student access. IPs may appear with one “R” saying that this IP was used by more than one student. 2. The session period is showed as a string of characters; a “*” says that some click was made and “-“ says that there was not any click. 3. The total number of clicks. I have made another improvement. During a week, we have several sessions and a student must go only to one session per week. Every student is member of a group and every group has an assigned session. If the teacher makes a mistake in taking attendance a student of other group, then he needs to remove it. In order to remove student’s attendance of a session, I have added a new column with radio buttons to select this action.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance v1.2.0 improved
ResponsesInList.Text: I attach the changed files “attendance.php” and "/lang/en_utf8/attforblock.php". To install this modification, backup the old code and replace it with the new one. This modification is full reversible, you can restore the old code without problems. I hope that this features will be added to the main branch of the attendance module in a near future. Again, thanks to Dmitry for its time. Enjoy the change.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple "sections"?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everybody- I'm a Moodle newbie but I am very impressed so far. I'm a firefighter with a large urban fire department, with a large MS Access training records database kept at the fire academy. My current job involves a ton of work just to keep this monster working, and I will move us over to Moodle, with a just little help. We (me and the academy's summer intern - a CS grad student, thankfully) have our basic setup running nicely on a windows box, with phpmyadmin, mrbs , and php acceleration added in. The intent is to begin with Moodle as a central record-keeping tool AND a repository for course presentation materials and handouts. Once it does that convincingly, and with less effort than what we have to do now, we'll expand into all the other features. So far, works GREAT. Our difficulty is this: the academy training right now is recorded in MS Access with three key fields: userid, courseid, and completion_date. The course duration varies from 23 weeks down to single day seminars. The thing to keep in mind is the focus on the completion date - the "finish date" which we use to build each FF's master training record and produce college-type transcripts . (We are also a credit-granting agency with a full-time registrar.) In terms of enrolling students, the six month courses and other "longer" courses work fine in Moodle as is. A student would only enroll in such a course once. The single-day training that we have is repetitive, though, and is scheduled in terms of firefighting units , not individual members/students. We know Engine 1 is coming for the drill, as scheduled, but the members working that day will be enrolled/recorded as trained only after they get here. A firefighter may come four times in a year for the same drill - "Tactical Unconscious FF Removal" or "Self-Rescue Rope Refresher." Upon completion of the drill, a hand-written sign-in sheet goes to the data-entry person. Most firefighters and their officers will repeat at least one of the single-day drills during a two-year period. They are essentially re-taking a one-day class. We've looked at groups , restoring courses, etc. and haven't found a solution yet. (One particular drill/class is conducted 300 days a year, and most training is conducted at least once a month.) The solution we desire will let the data-entry person, who is swamped, enroll anyone off of her backlog pile, some of it more than a month old, as well as the current 'today' students. It will let specialty instructors build attendee lists for future multi-week classes that are offerred 4x a year. And, eventually, regular instructors in the classroom will sign in to Moodle and before starting their refresher training Powerpoints or printing their new handouts, they can go around the room and take names/enroll students right from the podium. In short, we need to enroll students in a course, then find and enroll them again in a new "section" of the same course next week or next month, and we need to back-fill 200,000+ training records across 20,000+ active/retired members within 400+ current/archive courses. We've been tempted to add a training_date to the role_ assignment table, then modify the assign.php/html files so when assigning the role 'student' for a course, the user will have to pick a 'section_complete_date.' (the date of training for one-day courses, and the "finish date" for multi-day or multi-week training.) As we say over the radio, "Can anyone advise...?"

ResponsesInList.Title: Integration between the ILP and Attendance module

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Integration between the ILP and Attendance module
ResponsesInList.Text: The ILP Module (Individual Learning Plan) is a module developed by James Ballard for Moodle. It can be used to track various bits of info about each student e.g. targets, achievements, concerns etc. I'm thinking of using it to easily track how long a student has taken to hand in a sick note after they were absent as well as tracking 'make up notes' we require for students who missed any teaching sessions. More info here: http://moodle.ulcc.ac.uk/course/view.php?id=107 )

ResponsesInList.Title: Strange Attendance module problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I just had a very strange problem occur with the attendance module. I am using the 2008627 version. My school does not use excused absences so our teachers don't use the "E" option in the attendance module. I downloaded attendance reports from 7 different classes two weeks ago in order to check attendance data in preparation for a test that we are giving. Everything looked normal at that time. The teachers were all using A & P (Absent and Present) to record their attendance. I just checked again today and suddenly everywhere that an A was used before has now turned into an E. I have no idea what caused this but it is just short of a disaster for us. In the Spring of this year I noticed that when a teacher goes in and changes the "My variables" for attendance settings in his/her course it sometimes causes the site wide defaults to be modified so I removed the capability to even see the "Setting" tab by modifying teacher permissions. Therefore I don't see how this sudden problem could be related to anything a teacher did but I'm not sure.... I now have a ton of attendance data that has been corrupted and I'm not sure what to do... Jason

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Attendance module problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jason! This is very very strange. I don't remember about your bug report in the spring and I don't see a possibility for this bug. Your current problem is more strange! Attendance which already taken can't be changed themselves. In any case if just "A" changed to "E" is not problem for repair at all. I hope that you didn't change anything directly in database ... I think I'll can help you if you'll send me: 1. Sources of your version of module 2. Old backup of one course (if you have) 3. Current backup of this course. I sent my email via Messaging.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Attendance module problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Dmitry, Thanks very much for such a fast response. Sorry, I didn't report a bug in the spring because I was swamped at the time and I couldn't really nail down exactly what the issue was. For the current issue, I forgot to mention one thing. The attendance module is set up for all courses (we have about 300) as follows: Present = 2 Absent = 0 Late =1 Excused = 0 When I noticed all the "E" on teachers attendance reports I looked at the settings and saw that Present and Absent both were set to a value of 2....This really has me perplexed because, as I mentioned in my first post, I have altered teacher permissions so they cannot modify the attendance settings. So, I can't figure out how they would have been changed. We did have some courses in the Spring that used only 2 possibilities for the attendance P or A and I removed the title for the other two settings in the attendance mod. So, when the teachers took attendance they saw 4 columns but only two had headings. At that time I did give one of the blank columns the value of 2 and the other 0. They would have been the A column and the E column. Anyway, so when I saw the P = 2, A = 2 this time I immediately went to the database and checked to see what the default setting was for A and was surprised to see it set to 2. I know it was 0 just two weeks ago because on the 20th of January I downloaded attendance reports for 7 classes (and still have them) and they were all in order (i.e. P was being given a score and A was being recorded as 0). I did change the default setting in the database back to 0. That way, as long as the teachers were judging by the letter (P = present A=Absent) the figures should be correct. Jason P.S. I am using Moodle 1.9.2+ Unfortunately all the courses contain sensitive student data so I cannot distribute them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Attendance module problem

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Attendance module problem
ResponsesInList.Text: OK. Now I fully understand what happened. Because default setting impossible to change from interface, I think you did it manually in database. But Status is saved in attendance_log table, not Acronym. Also when you went at Settings page we check that acronym and description (of defaults!) corresponding to your language (because user can't change them). Grades don't changing also because user can't change them. I see you have phpMyAdmin , so I send you SQL query which repair database.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Attendance module problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Jason, for making query you should give me a date of first broken session or starting date of first broken course (I think you have old courses where all right). Date of session or date of course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multiple sessions per day
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, to disable same day check just comment these (in green and bold) lines in mod/attforblock/sessions.php (starting from line 65): //if($count != 0) //duplicate session exists //error(get_string('sessionalreadyexists','block_attendance'), "sessions.php?id=$id&action=add"); //else { // insert session $rec->courseid = $course->id; $rec->creator = $USER->id; $rec->sessdate = $sessdate; $rec->description = $desc; if(insert_record('attendance_sessions', $rec)) { add_to_log($course->id, 'attendance', 'one session added', 'mod/attforblock/manage.php?id='.$id, $user->lastname.' '.$user->firstname); notice(get_string('sessionadded','block_attendance')); } else error(get_string('errorinaddingsession','block_attendance'), "sessions.php?id=$id&action=add"); //} This will disable "same day check" and I don't see any disadvantages accept that when you create export dates are displayed without description (so you must see which column is for what "same day session").

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Letting students view their attendance with the activity hidden
ResponsesInList.Text: I've found a solution for anyone else who has this issue. What can be done it simply to take the id of the instance of the attendance activity out of 'sequence' in mdl_course_section. It will need to be set to visible but once it is taken out of here it will not be displayed on the course page while not having the permission problem due to being hidden. Mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Letting students view their attendance with the activity hidden

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Grades not posting to Gradebook/No groups shown on 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: School starts today so I was fiddling around with attendance and discovered that the key was not setting the aggregation method (it was coincidental to what I did apparently). Through a little trial and error we discovered yesterday that I had to go to the "Edit categories and items" page in gradebook, click the edit hand next to the attendance module's listing, and then click the "Save changes" button (even though I didn't make any changes). This then went through a couple of seconds to process the attendance and correctly report the attendance grades to the gradebook.

ResponsesInList.Title: New Attendance Scanning Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, At our Bible College (WHBTC) in Salford (UK) we run up to 8 sessions a day (morning + evening) for 3 different groups (Year 1 Part/Full time & Year 2 Full time) We would like students to use a scanning system (Barcodes or something else) so we can track their attendance.  They should just scan in in the morning and scan out in the afternoon.  (Not in and out for each session) We want the system to automatically recognise which student was late/absent/left early from which session etc. This would free any admin staff from having to log the students attendance manually. (We have different rules for international students (stricter) and we have a very strict attendance/make up policy - more below) We already have a simple version of this idea working on a MS Access Database but would like to develop a Moodle version so that students can view their attendance directly on the web. Our attendance policy tries to discourage absentism by forcing students to buy CDs/Mp3s of missed sessions hand in make up notes. We want our module to selectively charge students for Mp3 downloads at different prices depending on whether or not they missed the session. Furthermore the system should be able to keep track of the submission, approval/rejection of make up notes and be able to do reporting at any level. Any ideas/suggestions would be appreciated. Barry Oosthuizen

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New Attendance Scanning Module
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a great concept! I hope it works for you and you share your learning with us (because I was wondering how we could do a similar thing at my organization). How will you track those few troublesome students that will ask their friend to scan their badge for them so they can sleep in late? (not that I would ever have done such a thing myself! )

ResponsesInList.Title: Fingerprint Scanning Module?
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess the near foolproof solution is to use a fingerprint scanner instead? Any thoughts on this? At the moment class monitors are appointed who have to manually record any absences, lates etc. This acts as a backup should anything suspicious be spotted or a system failure take place. It does not add to our staff workload as trustworthy students are appointed for this task. Also, the serious consequences for a student caught cheating act as an effective deterrent.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fingerprint Scanning Module?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just a thought, but RFID security badges would be a helpful way (Or MSR Card Swipes) for companies to keep track of attendance.

ResponsesInList.Title: New Dmitry's version of attendance block (v1.0.6)
ResponsesInList.Text: 1.0.6 - 2 feb 2006 Dmitry Pupinin [moodle.org member] + dates in head of report table is links to update attendance + percent calculating is updated + each acronym in table head on "Update attendance" page now works as "Select All" for radiobuttons in his column (thanks to Michael Deane for idea) + date formats define in langs * bug fixed: not all users were in Excel and Text exports FAQ: Q: Why attendance percent on pages of block don't equal to percent in Gradebook? A: Gradebook display how much points student had in this course in comparison with how much he could have. Pages of block display percent of attendance. For example, if student for presence had 3 points and for absence had 1 point then he can't have 0% in Gradebook even though he was absent always, but on block pages in this situation he will have exactly 0%. Good news:

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance Date
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I am new to Moodle, very new, and I have been searching for a way to display the dates in the Attendance module differently.  Currently, the dates are displayed date/month/year which is very confusing.  When I see 04/07 I think April when the date is actually July 4. Is there a way to change this so it is displayed month/date/year?  Thank you for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Date
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, Richard! My recollection is that I changed those strings for the US language pack. Naturally other countries use other date formats. Are you comfortable with editing a little code? Look in the language file (block_attendance.php in the language folder) for something that looks like this: $string['strftimedm'] = '%%m.%%d'; $string['strftimedmy'] = '%%m.%%d.%%Y'; $string['strftimedmyw'] = '%%m.%%d.%%y (%%a)'; $string['strftimeshortdate'] = '%%m.%%d.%%Y'; These are the US English strings, and you can see that they are in the format of month date and year. You can either swap the language file or just edit it to match.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Date
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmm. I did develop a custom language pack for our instance. I did this because I didn't want to keep re-installing language files everytime we updated! But Moodle 1.9 is supposed to allow for the language files to be stored in the module/block directories themselves! You might just try copying the language file and dropping it in the main language folder. In the old days it worked! Here are my notes on creating a custom language pack, but I will tell you that they are really for 1.8 and should be getting obsolete. Here are a couple of other interesting links; maybe they will help? http://docs.moodle.org/en/Installation_FAQ --look for "Why doesn't my Moodle site display the time and date correctly?" http://docs.moodle.org/en/Language_packs --(How to install a second laguage pack) Good luck! atw

ResponsesInList.Title: Help with attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, here we go: My agency is a large-ish fire department. We are loving the idea of using Moodle for our training record-keeping system, but have hit a wall, and we are looking for a little help with attendance. We have many courses that are once-in-your career only. Standard Moodle is working great in that regard. The big issue is that we also have a number of training courses that are single-day refreshers - Tactical Refresher, Auto Extrication Referesher, etc. Every day that training happens we have firefighting units rolling through the gate to our academy to train on these refresher-type courses. These units are selected based on their unit training history. The staffing on these units is handled elsewhere, and typically there are last-minute changes and manpower swaps. We only discover who is being trained today AFTER they arrive at training. The goal is thus to have all active members (students) enrolled in every refresher course automatically (done) and then take attendance daily. The problem is, our attendance list for the day is thousands of names long for each course. Additionally, we have dozens of duplicates on first name/last name. We truly need help with this. Is there any way to simplify this? We really like the functionality/behavior of the role assignment screens, where we search for potential users then select and enroll them in a course. We have even done a (minor) hack where we can find these users by name OR by unit, and are very satisfied with that enhanced usability . We have taken the good advice however to not hack up the assign.php/assign.html files any further, as we risk breaking things in plenty of other places. Can anyone direct us to a person or place who can help us resolve this issue through using the attendance module?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, Martin! You might try messaging Dmitry directly. He is the author of the attendance module. I am wondering if you could use groups? I haven't used groups much in my classes, but it seems to me that attendance did support groups. I think they were coded by ID number, not whatever string you assigned to name the group, but if you wrote down the ID number when you created the group, you could figure it out. And it might have been fixed by now! That is the best advice I can give you at this time. The other option would be to hire a developer. I am not sure if you want to go that route or not!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: The groups problem has indeed been fixed in the Attendance module. I was going to suggest the same thing--each station with their own group would work fairly well. Since people can belong to multiple groups, you can also create groups based on level (e.g., Fire Fighter II, Fire Fighter I, Engineer, et al.) and special certifications (e.g., EMT, Paramedic) so you can quickly check who in a specific group still needs the class.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how  install attendance in moodle 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, Nada! I think it is the same process used in 1.8. The name of the block is attendance . ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance Grades not being submitted to gradebook 1.8.4+
ResponsesInList.Text: I have just discovered a weird 'quirk' with the Attendance module. I had a teacher who changed the 'settings' and removed one classification (the first one "P") and set the value to zero (0). The resulting settings that he was using are as follows: Status Acronym Description Grade P (nothing) (nothing) 0 A P Present 2 L L Late 1 E A Absent 0 When he used these settings, the attendance grades were not being displayed by the gradebook. I poked around in the database forever trying to figure out why 'attendance' was not showing up as a graded event in his gradebook and finally got it to show by changing the grade for his "P" setting that he wasn't using to a numeric value (greater than 0). I changed it to 2 and everything shows up now.

We have a tutor (non-editing teacher) in each of the classes (groups). What we want is to have the tutor add new sessions and take attendance for them with students in their class (group). Is it thus possible to have the Attendance activity more group-oriented?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: An "attendance clerk" would have to be able to open every course on the system. I think the *best* way to do this would be to create some kind of role that allowed the person to do this. However, I cannot help you design such a role! That is beyond me! You might be able to duplicate a role such as non-editing teacher and modify it for the attendance clerk. I think you must know that current attendance module is very tied to the course. By that, I mean that you would not be able to look up attendance by student and automatically see how that student was doing across several courses. atw

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Do you think you might get some help if you posted in the roles and capabilities forum? http://moodle.org/mod/forum/view.php?id=6826 As I said, I have not done much with any roles except the legacy roles. So I would not feel qualified to advise you. atw

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Carina, First, am I correct in assuming that you have installed the Attendance package (block and module)? It is found here or from the Modules and Plugins page. With Dimitry's attendance package installed you should be able to take attendance for a class. Unless you have also installed the ' auto attendance ' option, taking attendance is always 'manual' meaning that a teacher, or someone, has to click on the attendance session for each day and then click on the correct item (present, late, absent etc.) for each student. If you want to allow a clerk to take attendance you could create an entirely new role and allow that person to take attendance or you could use non-editing teacher as you have mentioned. I guess what I am not clear about is whether or not you have the basic attendance package installed and functioning properly? From the looks of the photo you have attached I guess you do have it working.... So you just want to create a new role so someone other than the teacher can take attendance? Is that correct? Jason

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Offline attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: I should clarify that the reason I suggest a new role is because of privacy issues. The attendance clerk role has to be able to get into any course on the system in order to mark attendance. However, that person should NOT (in my view and legally, in the US) be able to see grades, student submissions, student posts in forums, etc. Therefore, just assigning the attendance clerk as a system admin would not be advisable. How you create a role that can do that is beyond me! But is probably needed in this case! atw

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Export errors in attendance

Can you help me find the right software like moodle to get this project working. Thank you so much.

ResponsesInList.Title: Sort problem when using groups - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: I have just had one of my users report a problem sorting lists when using groups. I have fixed this by making the following edit to 1.0.9 In file blocks/attendance/updateAttendance.php around line 97 I changed $students = get_group_users($currentgroup); to $students = get_group_users($currentgroup, "u.$sort ASC"); This has resolved the problem for us and does not seem to have caused any problems so far. Regards Steve

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance Comment Problem
ResponsesInList.Text: We have experienced a problem with the comment jumping around to a different user with the new module and I was writing to notify Dmitry but to warn people what is happening and how to fix it. With the new system when registration is taken for a course you now have to choose absent or present rather than students all being marked as absent. We have a register which includes teachers and some courses have 3 or 4 teachers on them. When one teachers takes the register they have not been marking the others present or absent, just leaving it blank. What this has been doing is making the comment in the comment box move to a different student when the OK button is pressed. This then logs the comment against another student. For example: Student S was absent because of a dentist appointment.  The comment "Dentist" was written in and OK'd and saved.  Because Teacher A did not have any mark (Present or Absent) recorded against her the comment actually jumped into Student T, who was present.  On a second viewing of the attendance for that session Student S was absent but no comment and Student T was present but comment was at the dentist. The way to fix it is to ensure all students and teachers are marked Present or Absent.  I know it should be that way but if you forget or don't bother you will get data errors. Dmitry, I don't know if you can look at this.  I am not sure what solution would be easiest to implement. Many thanks, Duncan Edwards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Comment Problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Duncan! If student is absent because of a dentist appointment or somthing else you should mark him as "Excused" and comment. It is not good idea leave student without any mark at all. But in any case you wrote about real bug. I fix it in near future! Thanks!

I have attached a screen dump of access so you can see the table. Many thanks, Duncan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Data to MS Access - in particular "sessdate"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Duncan, The sessdate field contains timestamps i.e. the number of seconds that have passed since midnight GMT on 1st January 1970. Thus 1156978800 converts to Wed, 30 Aug 2006 23:00:00 GMT. You may find the discussion How does date / time in DB convert to real Date / Time? helpful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Data to MS Access - in particular "sessdate"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for that.  I had looked at the Developer Forum, but clearly not put the right search criteria in. All I need to do now is get Access to work it out! Once again, thank you. Duncan

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple classes?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, I may be missing something really obvious here, but I'm wondering how to handle multiple classes with different students.
I teach a course with two separate classes on different days each week, which I separate into two groups in Moodle. Is there a way to have attendance for each group or do I need to replicate the course? I tried adding attendance for each of the two days to the single attendance block, and then just taking attendance for each group on their respective days, however both days show up when I view the report and it likewise affects the students attendance grade. Is there a better way to do this? Thanks kindly, Julian.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple classes?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Julian I have the same problem - same topic on 3 days a week. What I've done is to change the score for 'excused' to the same as 'present' and for those not supposed to be there, their expted absence at that session does not penalise them (does that make sense?). It's only a small group (33 students in total) so it's too bad to do, but it would be a bit tedious for a larger group. What is interesting is that there is active competition for the grades, and people are checking their attendance regularly (these are post-grads) Hope this helps

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple classes?
ResponsesInList.Text: For the moment I can suggest one simple idea: If you have same topic in several days for separated groups, add only one session for a week (eg on friday if last group study on friday) and take attendance for all groups by friday.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple classes?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Robin and Dmitry, I get what you're saying Robin. I thought of just signing everyone as present for the classes they weren't in so that it wouldn't affect the score. The only problem with that is the report shows all the classes still. Which means that for a twenty week course, there's forty columns. I hadn't thought of that Dmitry but it is a good idea. Then it wouldn't matter how many classes there was for that week. Is supporting multiple classes/groups planned for the future? Thanks, Julian.

ResponsesInList.Title: Human Logic attendance block 1.2
ResponsesInList.Text: HI , We are very happy to announce the 1.2 release version of Attendance block. It can also be found in the CVS contrib section of moodle. Iam happy to notify all of you that this time round this block upgrades itself smoothely without corrupting any existing data. But please go through the ReadMe.txt file before you install it. The main enhancements are -Global settings available for attendance block, for uniform standardized attendance policies across the system. -Individual course settings available in attendance block. Each instructor can customize his/her course attendance as per their individual policies. These settings will override the global settings for the attendance block. -Customized weighting is now available for excused, absent and late options. -Report tab, intially designed by Dimitry, has been fixed with large modifications. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggestions for grading attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Looks like this forum has been quiet for a while now.  I like the ideas that Adam has proposed here and just wanted to add one suggestion/request.  I usually grade attendance with a 'participation' factor included.  What I mean here is that I give students a number (between 0 and 3) which gives me some baseline quantitative data linked to their attendance and participation.  The 0 is for an absence, a 1 for a tardy or sleeping in class (happens all too often at the university where I am currently teaching), a 2 for being on time and alert in class, and finally a 3 for above average participation in class plus being on time and alert.  If the attendance feature would allow me to use these numbers and then calculate attendance based on a 'total possible' that I am able to enter manually, that would be additionally grand Also, it would be really nice if the total number of 0's could be calculated for me but that may be asking for too much...?  I do all of this now in Excel but it would be nice to have it all on line where students could check their 'status' as the semester progresses. Just some ideas. Jason

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggestions for grading attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes to Adam's and Jason's comments! My current non-moodle system uses 15 different marks, all with different point values that are calculated into a student's total grade: A (absent, 0 points), AE (absent excused, 4 points), SR (school related absence excused, 4 points) and so forth... I don't wish to bore you! The addsession.php page is good: it allows you to customize the acronym, description, and percentage. All I need is to be able to specify the number of different marks. Right now, the number of marks is fixed at 4. I believe this tweak would also meet Jason's needs, and most other teachers. Then I would just convert my point system to the existing percentage system - no big deal.

ResponsesInList.Title: New attendance block
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi everybody- We were asked by a client of ours to customize
Moodle 1.5 for them. The client was generous enough to allow us to
release their customizations back to the Moodle.org community. Since the attendance module is no longer maintained, we approached it
differently. We wanted to design something that wouldn't require an
in-depth integration with Moodle but would be easy enough if required in the long run.
A block seemed like the obvious way. =) PURPOSE The attendance block is designed to allow instructors of a course keep an attendance log of the students in their courses. The instructor will setup the frequency of his classes (# of days per week & length of course) and the attendance block is ready for use. To take attendance, the instructor clicks on the "Update Attendance" button and is presented with a list of all the students in that course, along with 4 options: Present, Absent, Late & Excused, with a Remarks textbox. Instructors can download the attendance for their course in Excel format or text format. Only the instructor can update the attendance data in the block. However, a student gets to see his attendance record as a block. Please note that the email block is still in development .
It is not the final release. This release is for testing purposes. It
is being released under the terms of the General Public License. Please
let me know if you run into any bugs or problems. I would greatly
appreciate it. Lastly, enjoy. Developing this block was a lot of fun for my development team. I hope you enjoy using it too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New attendance block
ResponsesInList.Text: Alright I have tested this quite a bit. I am just going to first say it installed fine the second time, all tables present. Next I just want to say the usability issues I had that you MAY want to consider depending on your client. I think they are pretty general though. First it only allows a bulk attendance add (where I select days of the week between two dates) once. Then you have to add day by day. If a teacher decides to use the course as a year long instead of as a semester, or just adds the dates to play with it, they then have to add the future dates one by one for the rest of the year. If possible you should have both the bulk and single session add displayed at all times when settings is clicked. Just have separate submit buttons so each person can add sessions however is convenient regardless of its the first or 8th time they are adding sessions. A delete all sessions button would be nice too if someone screws up, that way they can easily start over from scratch. Maybe just at the bottom of the attendance tab (the one you get to by first clicking settings). I think this is really minor but I would either display last names then first names, or have it put last names first when you sort by last name. Every roster I have seen is last name, first name. I do not know if you client has it this way, but if they do it would be helpful for them likely to see it the same way their roster shows it. My other issues still stand as well. Teachers should be able to create sessions and manage them instead of just admins. Also teachers should have a stats tab under settings that basically shows a percentage like the scripts shows to students. Ideally teachers could select how many tardies and excused absences make an absent, say anywhere from 0 (do not count as absences at all) through 5 where each tardy or excused would be one-fifth of an absence). That way the script could be adjustable by the teacher to suit their needs and make sure it shows an accurate percentage to the teacher and students of their attendance. Even without the adjustability it would be highly beneficial to at least display the current percentages for each students on-time is a stats tab as I stated before teachers can then use this to determine an attendance grade, as well as it being an easy way to see each students attendance in general thourhgout the semester or year. Sorry to put so much stuff down, but you said it was under develepment so I figured I would test it out and try to give some input while I can from a teachers and admins perspective Thanks for the block and I hope something I said helps you and your client make the script fit the needs of students and teachers using it. mrjohnston

ResponsesInList.Text: Manel- Thanks for testing the attendance block =) Attendance for classes is attendance. Normally, it isn't hourly based, rather is session based. Let me know if it works. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Waleed, As others have stated, I really appreciate this attendance block, which is just great! I have one little problem with the block, which I would like to tell you and others about, to see whether anyone can help fix it. When I mark an absent student as excused (for illness for example) this session should be excluded from the percentage attendance, but this is not happening.  You can see an example from the screenshot below.  The student has not been absent at all, and has been excused once in 6 lessons, so the attendance should be 5/5 = 100 %, but instead it is 5/6 = 83%! I'm sure that fixing this would be a fairly simple change to one line (touch wood!) but I'm hopeless at PHP and wonder if anyone could give me a pointer as to which line I need to change to fix this faulty arithmetic. Thanks in advance! Tim.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmmmmm.  It is easy to change; but is that the way all teachers calculate excused absences? Is it fair to grade two students the same if one makes an effort to schedule a doctors appt. during non-school hours and the other does not?  It would seem that we may need to code a choice in the block settings that define how excused abesences should be calculated based on the teachers preferences. Lady800cc

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I got brave and took the plunge and think I found a solution: In the file index.php, change line 295 from this: $percent = number_format( (100 * ($present + $late) /($complete)),2) . ' %'; To this: $percent = number_format( (100 * ($present + $late) /($complete-$excused)),2) . ' %'; It might not bet the best hack (make a new variable?), but it works for me. Hope this helps anyone else, Tim.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmmmmm - I'm think you missed the point. There is a valid question as to whether a student who was excused for one lesson out of  four (for example) should have their attendance calculated as 3/3 = 100% or 4/4 = 100%.  I think the first is more logical, but others may have different opinions on that. The second issue is whether the "Attendance percent" is intended to be a mere count of how many times the students has attended classes,  or whether it is some kind of qualitative score of their attendance.  I suppose there could be a preference setting for this but IMHO for most people a percentage (especially in this context ) implies a kind of assessment and therefore if that is not what was intended it should be changed (because it is misleading).  If the intention is to merely  document how many times the student has attended then a simple total would suffice (which is in fact already there as " Number of days present "). IMHO nothing needs to be coded into Moodle regarding what an "excused absence" ("E" in the attendance block) is - that can just be left up to the judgement of individual teachers.  I just gave one example, but what if a student fell sick and was rushed to hospital, would it be fair to penalize the student in that case? There are many different scenarios, and from the Moodle point of view it should be left up to the teacher to decide what he or she wishes to excuse and not to excuse. If a teacher wishes to never excuse anyone, then they would never mark a student as "E" and therefore the problem would never arise.  But if there is even just one occasion on which a teacher would excuse a student, then it would surely be wrong to penalize them vis-a-vis another student - because that is what "excused" means! Otherwise there would be no need to even make a distinction between "Excused" and "Absent". Anyway, this is just my opinion - what do others think? Tim. PS Let me re-iterate to Waleed - this is a fantastic block!  Thank you once again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: Tim- Thanks for letting me know about the excused students attendance calculation. I'll talk to my team tomorrow and see what its all about. As for how one calculates attendace, we took a basic approach to it. If they're not in class, then it's a count against them. The attendance block was to note how many times a student was in class, and if wasn't in class, then the official reason presented to the students. That's how our client wanted it done. At the same time, I understand what you're saying Tim. If a student is excused, then they are excused with a reason from their attendance being counted towards the final grade. However, if they missed class without an excuse, then it is an absent count against them. How a teacher handles excused absences and unexcused unabsences is their choice. We can make a note of this recommendation for future updates of the attendance block. Thanks for that. Only with your feedback is that possible. =) Hope that helps Tim. I'll post an update on the excused attendance situation tomorrow. -Waleed PS: Glad you like/love the attendance block =)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanx for the help Tim, I was having that problem too. I added a few changes after I saw what you did: $percent = number_format( (100 * ($present + $late) / ($present + $late + $excused + $late) + $excused)),2) . ' %'; Why: If a student joins in mid-term it will calculate his attendance based on the total sessions marked, rather than just the classes he has taken.  eg. If there were 20 classes and a student joins in for the last 5, he will only be able to get a total of 25%. There is also no way of marking him excused for any days before he was enrolled without editing the database. This will total up all sessions he has been enrolled in the class for and give a correct percentage. ps. there is also a mod attached that takes homework information as well, I found that the two look work good together. It's only the same one with a few changes made to it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with excused absences
ResponsesInList.Text: I think I meant this: $percent = number_format( ( 100 * ($present + $late) / ($present + $late + $excused + $absent - $excused )),2) . ' %'; which could just be written like this: $percent = number_format( ( 100 * ($present + $late) / ($present + $late + $absent) ),2) . It's seems to be working for me. Make the following change everywhere in the code for all of the files that use this piece of code [within the attendence folder]: Change: if (isteacher($USER->id)) To: if (isteacher()) Now everything is working perfect except that the block should not display at all for guests. It's a minor issue in that the links for a student show, when logged in as guest; but if you click the links there will be no data because there is no 'studentID'.  Otherwise, with the above changes, the teacher can use the attendence block no problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: A different algorithm for the attendance module?
ResponsesInList.Text:
In the discussion about rewriting the attendance module Howard' wondered whether it is "worth the trouble at all". I think some sort of attendance function is required, particularly for those instructors who use Moodle in a computer lab situation, as do many language teachers, in particular. I've
built my own using a different algorithm that perhaps is better, algorithm-wise, although my code, too, is not so well written:  On
the course settings page, the days & times of class meetings plus
how many minutes after the start is considered 'late' are set (and can
be set differently if the course has groups inside it).  When a student
enters a course, 1) a cookie is set and 2) one record is placed in the
mdl_attendance table.  As long as the cookie is set to this course for
the set duration of the class, no other records are written to the
mdl_attendance table. The admin block then has a link for 'attendance today' and 'attendance
this term' which displays green, yellow (late) or red dots for each
student for each class meeting day.  An excel spreadsheet can also be
printed out. The advantage of this set-up is that it isn't a module at all, but rather something that happens passively as long as the student logs into the page during classtime (or within 15 min. before it starts).  If you wanted to get fancy, you could also have an IP address filter so that 'attendances' from remote locations aren't recorded as such.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A different algorithm for the attendance module?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Some thoughts for developers of the attendance block. There seems to be an overlap in requests on these Moodle forums for an attendance report and management system that automatically records and reports on the regular online engagement by students and one that a teacher can use to manually record, manage and report on face-to-face attendance in regular class. One system could easily cover both. I envisage that this could work if there is an
option for the system to automatically flag a daily attendance event for a course when a student click engages (perhaps at
least twice on a day).  This might resolve some of time zone issues raised by another user or requirement for all students to be online at once. Another option may be for a teacher to manually flag on a particular day another attendance event (user defined as absent / present / late / sick etc) . The information kept in the student attendance log table could then be tabulated into a report that would mirror the familar attendance roll kept by teachers, export to a spreadsheet etc. Is this what other users are looking for?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: The biggest problem is that you can add one Attendance activity in one week, but the module will create activities in every week! And you can't delete them easily. I think the whole concept needs revisiting. For example, it would probably be better done as a block, with a nice little graphical display showing attendance for the whole course period or the current week. I'm still keen to delete the module entirely from the main CVS tree (and move it to contrib)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: My +1 for moving it to contrib, IMO developers have much greater freedom to modify it there and you do not have to merge the changes back to head I have updated my report on security.moodle.org.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Attendance is now gone from HEAD and MOODLE_15_STABLE. The upgrade procedure tries to deal with it nicely, by disabling the module if it had data, or deleting the tables if it wasn't being used. If anyone wants Attendance, they can easily reinstall it from the modules download page , or from its new location in cvs:/contrib/attendance I still love the idea of automatically (and optionally, manually) keeping some sort of attendance record or statistics, and would like to see it come back someday!  I think a block makes the most sense ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Martin, While attendance records may seem unimportant, I have been surprised at the number of times attendance patterns have been a most valuable diagnostic for helping a struggling student.  Currently attendance records are not mandatory at our school, so every teacher who keeps attendance has their own method and format (mostly individually-created xls or docs).  I have been hoping some attention would be paid to an attendance module so that teachers who desire to keep attendance could have a standardized method that's integrated into the rest of the on-line management system. I don't have an opinion about what approach is best (not familiar with blocks), I am just glad to see that there is at least some interest in resurrecting attendance.  I am only a beginner with php (though I have a lot of experience in C/C++) so I am not in a position to help at this point, but if someone does begin work on attendance, I would be interested in testing/reviewing any alpha version as soon as it became available. Thanks, Jim Robertson.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: The problems that we have found are: 1. A student can not see if he/she is absent in a particular roll. Currently, the student sees that he/she is always present(mod/attendance/view.php). If the student wants to view all rolls, it says 'Sorry, there is no data for your account here'(mod/attendance/viewall.php). The teacher has no such problems. 2. The teacher gets 'Course module is incorrect' when he/she tries to 'View All Attendance Rolls from the Calendar Week'.(mod/attendance/viewweek.php?scope=week). 3. Teachers don't like the text ' http://www.alpine-usa.com/company_info/press_release/010804_ipad.html' at the bottom(mod/attendance/viewall.php). I don't know why it is there. 3. Student's don't like the texts 'Dynamically moved to section: No Automatic from logs: No Graded: No'. There should be some options to show/hide these texts. 4. When a roll is moved from one section from another, a new attendance activity is created. Don't know, why. We can start with fixing these problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Howard! It is very nice of you to look into the possibility of " refactoring " (Did I use this term correctly? You know I am still in the learning process. ) the Attendance module. I hope it is " OK " to add to Vijay's wish list (to include some things I have learned while using Moodle and playing with code)? 1.  Making the Attendance module send results to a central table (I read about this a lot with the Gradebook module) so that it is easier to move students (From what I understand this feature will be in future Moodles relating to the Gradebook) between different classes with the same subject and still maintain their attendance record on a continuum.  Also this will be helpful when Student Moodle pages, Parent Moodle pages, Guidance Counselor Moodle pages, (in other words " Role " specified pages are eventually developed. 2.  Making attendance " PDA " compatible so teachers, parents and specified others can take and monitor attendance from a HandHeld . 3.  Making it optional to assign a grade to attendance which is determined by a specified protocol.  For example, 100% attendance is worth 100 points, 90% - 99% attendance is worth 95 points, etc. 4.  Ability to automatically make certain days count toward attendance and others not.  For example, weekends. 5.  Ability to fine tune what days count toward attendance and which ones do not.  For example there may be A weekend activity that students are expected to partake in. A holiday within the week that is a "no school" day for students. A protracted holiday affecting weekdays. For example, spring break I think I am done for now. WP1

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: I'd like to see a lot more thought go into any new version because I think there will be better ways to do the same thing (and go further).  The existing module is still there for anyone who wants it. Some ideas: One thing that must change is that one attendance activity must not spew multiple copies of itself throughout the course.  It's confusing to users and it breaks a lot of rules in the code which causes other problems (eg backups). If it was a block it could - be self-contained - not be tied to any particular topic or week - function across/between courses - provide an overview display that is always there For repeating events, it could add entries into the calendar, entries with links that called the block with different parameters. I also think the automatic mode should process the standard Moodle logs in order to find out when students were present or not.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't see why an attendance feature should be a resource/activity since there should never be multiple instances of it in a course, should there?  A block would make much more sense. As far as an automatic feature does, I first tried culling the info out of the logs, but it was just too slow.  For this reason, I decided that separate file that placed copies of relevant records in a separate file was much more efficient.  See my separate posting on this matter. http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=24913

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: For sure, there would be no need to re-process old dates where the logs weren't changing, results for these would be stored within Attendance in summary form.  Only logs for the current hour/day/week/whatever would need to be examined.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance problems
ResponsesInList.Text: As far as I know the attendance module was for checking use of the online system (I never used it) but you are looking for something to check offline attendance - in a physical chapel building, is that correct? Prof Okuda, Narumi Sekiya and Thomas Robb have developed the feedback module (originally an adapted journal module) http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=22526 with which one can give each student a unique random code number in chapel (perhaps handing them out at the door) that the students then have to enter into the feedback module for that week. The problem is that one has to print and cut out enough little pieces of paper for the numbers, but it was very popular with the teachers that tried it here. BTW Recently photocopiers have been installed in our university that connect directly to my computer. I believe it is possible to merge data from microsoft word and excel, so that, for example a column of addresses is taken from an excel file and added to the top of a letter, so that each letter printed has a different address. The same technique could be used to concatenate the code number with some lecture notes, or chapel hyms, so that the unique identifier is appended to the top of a lecture/chapel handout. Swipe cards can be lent to other students. Chris Martin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: analyze use and logins
ResponsesInList.Text: Current version of Moodle (1.4+) is really lacking a tool for retrieving students' activity in a downloable Excel format. I am thinking of something along the lines of WebCT's Track Students tool, which neatly displays the following info for students enrolled in one given course: Personal Information     Access Information         Articles Full Name User ID First Access Last Access Hits Items Read Posted (where Articles = Forum discussions in Moodle) All we have available at the moment is the "people" block, which gives a list of the particpants with their login status ( Never or time elapsed since last login ). This is not very helpful, and if more details are needed, then the only way is to click on a students' name, which gives too many details and we lose the "class" overview. What is needed is something in between the "minimal" participants list with login dates and the detailed "individual" data. In the present block: people -> participants -> the list looks like this: First name  / Surname    City/town    Country    Last access John Smith    Rennes    France    25 days 23 hours John Doe    Rennes    France    5 days 3 hours a) I personally do not find it very useful to have Last access displayed as time elapsed and would find it clearer to have this as a date & time instead (but this is a matter of taste) b) I really need not one column where first name & last name are put together, but 2 separate columns , sortable, of course. In the present system it is possible to sort the "First name/Surname" column on either First Name or Surname, which is a good thing. Unfortunately, when you do a sort on e.g. Surname, then Surnames are displayed in alphabetical order but, unfortunately First Names are not, which means we can have the following: Peter Smith    Rennes    France    25 days 23 hours John Smith    Rennes    France    5 days 3 hours What is needed here is that when a primary sort is wanted on First Name a secondary sort be done on Surname, and vice versa. I'd be grateful if someone could suggest ways of overcoming these problems. Joseph_R PS Regarding the display of data about students' visits & activity in Moodle in general, I do not care much about graphics being displayed (they are useful, of course) but what I need in order to track my students' activity are data downloadable in Excel format , for further examination, etc.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: different attendance rolls for same course
ResponsesInList.Text: Apparently not The common trick with other modules is to assign a teacher to each group and to set "separate groups" for that activity. ResponsesInList.Title: Add Multiple feature now present
ResponsesInList.Text: I've finished the 'add multiple' feature. Just go into the add screen for an attendance instance, and click the 'add multiple rolls' link at the bottom of the form. ResponsesInList.Title: Just a suggestion for an enhancement.
ResponsesInList.Text: I find the attendance module is extremely useful. I use it in all the classes I teach with Moodle. The only thing, I believe, would make this module more effective is to add time element for example: A class meets every Monday at 3 pm. for 2 hours in a computer lab or online then any student login to the class at 3 pm. and will be attended automatically, if s/he logout then the time s/he stayed online will be the period s/he was attending the course; therefore will be graded according that time. ResponsesInList.Title: attendance at small group seminars
ResponsesInList.Text: We need an attendance module as well. However we have the added complication that once a week the whole class is split into smaller groups. These groups then meet for a seminar, led by a seminar leader who takes an attendance record. We would like the seminar leader to enter this attendance record into Moodle, so that the teacher can see it for all students. Now it would be very inconvenient if the individual seminar leader has to search for his small number of students inside the long list of all class participants in order to enter their attendance. Instead the seminar leader should be shown a list of only those students that were supposed to show up for his particular meeting. Of course Moodle needs to know which student belongs to which seminar group. We are proposing to hold that information an extra column of the user_students table. There also has to be an additional table course_groups, each entry of which corresponds to a group and determines the group's seminar leader. It is the id number of the group in this table that is contained in the extra column of the user_students table. Using the information in these tables, a seminar leader can automatically be shown only those students from the large class that were actually supposed to attend his seminar. Maybe Russell can build this functionality into his module, if not we will build on his work later. And Russell: we need it soon

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance module
ResponsesInList.Text: yeah, you have to use cvs to get it. Do this: make a directory for your cvs checkout. call it whatever you want. Then: From a Unix/Linux computer To connect and login for the first time to the CVS server, you can use this command: cvs -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.moodle.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/moodle login There is no password - when asked for one, just hit Enter. To checkout ( download ) the entire Moodle code for the first time, use this command: cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.moodle.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/moodle co contrib Later, to update your local copy of Moodle to the current version in CVS you just need to go into your local moodle directory and type: cvs update -dP From a Windows computer To get started with a fresh copy of Moodle, follow the following steps: 1. Get TortoiseCVS from tortoisecvs.org and install it, then reboot. 2. Find or create a new folder somewhere where you want Moodle to be downloaded to. 3. Right-mouse-click that folder and choose "CVS Checkout" from the menu. You should see a dialog box. 4. Copy this text into the CVSROOT field: :pserver:anonymous@cvs.moodle.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/moodle 5. Press the button: "Fetch list...". 6. To the right of the button you'll see a list of modules: choose "contrib" from that list. 7. Press the button: "OK" and everything should be downloaded. (paraphrased from http:// http://moodle.org/mod/resource/view.php?id=8 ) Otherwise, just use the one I've attached. It's pipin' hot fresh!

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic attendance logging based on activity now present
ResponsesInList.Text: I've added the automatic attendance logging feature to the module. Any attendance roll that has this option checked will be edited by the cron library function to reflect whether a student has performed ANY activity at ANY TIME on the day of the attendance roll. I've left this feature pretty simple for the time being. If the roll contains multiple hours, all hours will be marked as present or absent based on whether the student performed any logged activities between 12:00 AM and 11:59 PM on that day. I'm willing to enhance this feature to allow for more options, but I'd like to know what users really want in terms of behavior. It's not entirely clear how the details of attendance as it's implemented would map to automation. Should there be time ranges to limit the attendance? How should multiple hours be mapped to that kind of time range? I've cleaned up and enhanced the page navigation bars for the multi-page views in this update as well. Have fun! Russ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How does this module keep trak of attendance
ResponsesInList.Text: It's set for manual attendance by default. Abbreviations are A=Absent T=tardy P=Present. If you turn on the 'track this attendance automatically' option for the instance it'll track whether the student logs any activity on the 24-hour period the attendance instance is set for. It doesn't log based on time-period between activities or anything like that. I decided not to do the work for that feature right away since I didn't know what users would really have a use for in that case.
